name: Sridhar
review_text: Golkonda Fort is a fascinating historical site with a lot to explore, but it requires at least 6 hours to see completely. The fort's architecture and history are impressive, but the lack of proper signs for guidance makes navigation a bit challenging. It's worth visiting, but be prepared for a long and unstructured exploration.

name: Himanshu
review_text:
Golconda Fort, located in Hyderabad, India, is a striking testament to the grandeur of medieval architecture and a fascinating blend of history, culture, and engineering. Originally built in the 16th century by the Kakatiya dynasty and later expanded by the Qutb Shahi rulers, the fort stands tall with its impressive walls, gateways, and watchtowers.

The fort's design is a marvel, with its acoustical system, which allows sounds to travel across vast distances, and the innovative water supply system. The sound and light show held in the evenings offers visitors an immersive glimpse into the forts rich history, narrating tales of intrigue, warfare, and royal life.

The climb to the top of the fort rewards visitors with panoramic views of the surrounding landscape, making it a perfect spot for photography. Inside, the remains of royal palaces, mosques, and a robust defense system are visible, allowing one to imagine the forts former glory.

While the fort can get crowded during peak hours, its vast size ensures that there's plenty to explore. Overall, Golconda Fort is a must-visit for history enthusiasts and anyone interested in experiencing the architectural brilliance of medieval India.

Weekend

name: S Q
review_text:
I went to this historic place multiple times. Climbing on top with family is like hiking,so many stairs .
Winters are the best season to go there during the day.
This time I went for the light & sound program which takes place in evening.
It was nice.The fort was looking majestic with beautiful lights. The program told us about the history of Golconda fort,& the iconic Kohinoor diamond  was found there.They should highlight the monuments structures also with their laser light,the program was more like a projector screen showing directly.The nearby structures were not discussed,Those who have seen light & sound program at Red fort New Delhi will understand,what I am saying.
But yes once we should watch this show in Hyderabads Golconda fort.

name: Priyanka
review_text:
I attended the light and sound show at Golconda fort, and it was a great experience. Not just the show is well presented and organized, it also tells you the history of the fort over the past several centuries. In a way, it was an eye opener for me for it explained how the fort was first envisioned and built by the Katikeya king Prataparudra in 11th century. I was earlier given to understand by the Telangana tourism guide that it was built by Qutub shahi rulers, and I thought it to be true until this show.
I wish I had more time during the day to visit and also explore the fort. Hopefully sometime in near future I shall do that too

name: Subho
review_text:
The mighty Golconda Fort of the bygone era is mostly in shambles today but still the remnants offer a glimpse of proud and glorious history of this majestic fort. Various interesting points rich with acoustic engineering are sure to enthrall the visitors. It takes atleast 3-4 hours of hustle to cover the fort entierly. The guides at the entrance quote very high amount for guided tour & dont budge with the price but if you are young its advisable to cover the fort by yourself after going through some information from Internet. Be sure to carry caps, sunglasses, bottled water, light snacks as its a bit tiresome to go uphill to cover few attractions.

name: Jitu Sharma
review_text:
Golconda Fort in Hyderabad is a magnificent historic site showcasing grand Turkish architecture and design. This massive fort has several sections, including mosques, gardens, halls, rooms, and famous sites like the Taramati Mosque and Qutub Shahi Masjid. The most fascinating aspect is its use of acoustic science -- sounds made at the entrance can be heard at the top of the fort, a marvel of engineering from centuries ago. Exploring the fort takes about 3-5 hours, and every moment is captivating. We also visited the Shri Mahakali Mandir located within the premises, which features stunning rock carvings and serene vibes. There's a small shop for snacks and water, making it convenient for visitors. Overall, it was an enriching experience filled with history, culture, and unforgettable memories.
Visited on
Weekday

name: Subhasis Pandit
review_text:
Golconda was the principal capital of the Qutub Shahi kings. The inner fort contains ruins of palaces, mosques and a hill top pavilion, which rises about 130 meters high and gives a bird's eye view of other buildings. The fortress rests on a granite hill 120 meters high while huge crenellated ramparts surround this structure.
Ticket counter is open from 5:30 PM
Note : Golconda Fort Timings: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM
Visited on
Weekend

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
No

name: Zaid Omer
review_text:
I spent a fantastic weekend exploring Golconda, and it was an absolute treat! The historic fort, with its imposing walls and intricate architecture, left me awestruck.

As I wandered through the ruins, I couldnt help but feel a sense of nostalgia wash over me. The sheer grandeur of the fort, combined with its rich history, made for a truly immersive experience.

One of the highlights of my trip was the stunning view from the top of the fort. Watching the sunset over the surrounding landscape was truly breathtaking.

If youre a history buff or simply looking for a unique weekend getaway, Golconda is definitely worth a visit. Be sure to wear comfortable shoes, bring plenty of water, and arrive early to beat the crowds.
Visited on
Weekend

name: shivani sharma
review_text:
Visiting Golkonda Fort was a beautiful yet challenging experience for me. The grandeur of the fort and the breathtaking views from the top made it unforgettable. However, wearing new shoes turned the climb into a real test, and my low stamina didn't make it any easier. But the satisfaction of reaching the top and witnessing the stunning sights made every struggle worth it.

One major drawback was the lack of toilets on the fort. Drinking water to keep myself energized left me with no options for relief, which was inconvenient. Adding better facilities would make the visit even more enjoyable.

Despite the challenges, it was a wonderful trip, and I'd recommend it to anyone who loves history and adventure--just come prepared with comfy shoes and some stamina!

name: Kirubhanandhan Raja
review_text:
Golconda Fort in Hyderabad is a fantastic place to visit, especially with friends and family. Its an ideal destination for a weekend outing, and the best part is that it's not overly crowded, making it a pleasant experience. You'll need around a day to fully explore and enjoy the fort.

Highlights:
Top View Convenience: There's a shop at the top where you can buy water, juice, and snacks.
Preparation Tips: If you're visiting during the day, carrying a water bottle is essential, and an umbrella can be handy for shade.
Unique Finds: Near the entry gate (right-side corner), you might find gooseberry vendors--a delightful treat if youre lucky.
Golconda Fort offers a perfect blend of history and scenic views. It's a great spot to relax, explore, and capture memories. Highly recommended!

Weekend

name: praveen chouksey
review_text:
10 LINES ON GOLCONDA FORT are:

In India, the state of Hyderabad, Telangana has a fort called the Golconda Fort, which was built during the Qutb Shahi dynasty.

The Golconda Fort was initially known as Golla Konda and the main entrance of the fort is Fateh Darwaza and was used as protection from the attacks of elephants

Golconda was known for the trade center of diamonds and was the principal capital for the kings of the Qutb Shahi.

The interior of the Golconda Fort includes mosques, a hilltop pavilion, and ruins and remainings of palaces.

The Golconda Fort has eight entrances and is regarded as the magnificent fort of India.

The highest or topmost point of this fort is Bala Hissarand was popular for its acoustic effects.

This fort was first built by the Kakatiya dynasty to protect the western portion of their kingdom.

The Mughal Emperor Aurangzeb attacked the Golconda Fort in 1686.

Aurangzeb attacked the fort to capture Hyderabad and in the process, he destroyed and looted the fort, leaving it as ruins.

The visit to this Golconda Fort is a must if you are visiting the state of Hyderabad as this fort covers a vast area and is very beautiful. The view from the hill is just excellent and splendid.

name: swetanshu shekhar
review_text:
Fantastic history and culture in display... this fort was originally built in 11th Century by Kakatiya rulers.... Later to Bahamani rulers.. Our very own Kohinoor diamond passed through these gates, it's a city in its own as it was cut out of mountain and was developed in many years and also contained markets and barracks for tradesman and Soldiers. The acoustics are a unique feature of the fort and also the light and sound show, please do see the sunset with the walls of the fort it's an amazing sight!
Visited on
Weekend

name: Ankit Raj
review_text:
Yes you are reading about Golconda Fort which is in Hyderabad , I will recommend you to visit there at liest once , what you will see i am explaining in few sentences.
1.History says that it was built in 11 th century by Pratapura king of Kakatiya Empire , initiative it was a small mud fort.

2.The fort was later developed into a fortified citadel in 1518 by Sultan Quli of the Qutb Shahi Empire and the city was declared the capital of the Golconda Sultanate.

Hey you can this things in wikipedia, but just go and enjoy that place i will recommend to book a guide, it will help you to understand the History!

Take some energy drink because you need to climb a lort of stairs.

Dont forget to go upper part of fort Where you can see the temple.
Okay Thanks

name: Naved Khan
review_text:
Golconda Fort is a must-visit historical gem! The architecture is impressive, and the acoustic engineering is fascinating--don't miss the clap echo at the entrance. The panoramic view of Hyderabad from the top is breathtaking, especially during sunrise or sunset. Be prepared for a climb, so wear comfortable shoes and carry water. The guided tours are highly informative and add depth to the experience. The fort's history and beauty make it a great spot for history buffs, photographers, and families alike. Highly recommend!

Weekend

name: Subham Gouda
review_text: Golconda Fort is an absolute gem of Hyderabad! The architecture is magnificent, reflecting its rich history and strategic importance. The panoramic views of the city from the top are breathtaking. Its a well-maintained site, and the guided tours offer fascinating insights into its past. Dont miss the sound and light show in the evening - it brings the forts history to life in a mesmerizing way. A must-visit for history enthusiasts and anyone looking to explore Hyderabads heritage!

name: Maha Dev
review_text:
Its a very huge place and clean tidy one can visit once a month or twice a month with their families and kids. Its a huge fort and maintained very well and a history place for lovers to visit at least once. Visit the fort as scenic beauty and from the top you can see the whole city from top of the fort.The evening lights and the show will be nice and but little boring but can be seen for once. The transportation with the public and private is very easy. Entry fee will be about 25/- for adults and free for kids and theshow is cost about 150/-.
Gardens and the gardening was maintained just like awesome and the greenery is very nice and air is so pleasant. They charge for parking lot around 10-20/-, It is the perfect example of our ancient ancestors architectural designs. It takes around 3-4 hours for an complete tour of the fort and snacks are available in the fort canteen itself.

Weekend

name: Kirtibala Pradhan
review_text:
Golconda Fort is a magnificent historical marvel that showcases the grandeur of ancient Indian architecture and engineering. The forts sprawling layout, intricate acoustics, and panoramic views of Hyderabad make it a captivating destination. Walking through its majestic gates and exploring its history-rich corridors is an unforgettable experience. A visit to Golconda Fort is a journey into the past, brimming with culture and heritage.

name: Mohammed Akber
review_text:
The name Golconda means round hill in Urdu, [5] however, others say that Golconda is thought to originate from Telugu for Cowherds hill (goll koNdd, romanized: Gullakonda).[6][7] It is also thought that Kakatiya ruler Ganapatideva 1199-1262 built a stone hilltop outpost -- later known as Golconda fort -- to defend their western region.[8] The fort was later developed into a fortified citadel in 1518 by Sultan Quli of the Qutb Shahi Empire and the city was declared the capital of the Golconda Sultanate.[7]

Weekday

name: Arshad Wasi
review_text:
Golkonda Fort, a majestic marvel of architectural grandeur, stands as a testament to the rich history of the Qutb Shahi dynasty. Perched atop a granite hill, this formidable fortress offers breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape.

Key attractions within the fort:

The Acoustic Wonder: Experience the incredible acoustics of the Bala Hisar Gate, where a clap at the entrance can be heard at the hilltop pavilion, a distance of over a kilometer.
The Royal Enclave: Explore the remnants of royal palaces, mosques, and temples, showcasing the opulent lifestyle of the Qutb Shahi rulers.
The Diamond Mines: Learn about the legendary Golconda diamonds, including the world-famous Koh-i-Noor, that were once mined in the region.
A visit to Golkonda Fort is a journey through time, offering a glimpse into the grandeur and strategic brilliance of bygone eras.

name: Sat Biswas
review_text:
One of the most iconic experiences visiting this amazing architectural splendour of medieval India. One must experience this beauty with some energy and stamina as one have to walk quite a bit to understand this place and its intricate detailing. Actually the hike is quite tiresome in the summer and recommend one to visit during winters. The only challenge is parking and one has to be in this place as early as 9:30 am to have any chances to park their car. Avoid the fictitious guides who would try every moment to convince you that without them the tour is impossible. Get your tickets booked online and you have a perfect opportunity to save time and energy. Carry water with you.
Visited on
Weekend

Wait time

review_text: Great but tiring as I have to climb at most places. The fort has at least 4 layers of security built by stone walls. name: Asif T Thottathil
review_text:
Golconda Fort in Hyderabad is a truly remarkable place, offering breathtaking views of the city from the top. The history and architecture of the fort are fascinating, and its a must-visit for anyone in the area. However, one disappointing aspect is the pollution caused by plastic bottles, bags, and other waste scattered around. The ponds and step-wells, especially near the temple, are heavily littered, which detracts from the beauty and heritage of this historic site. It would be wonderful if stricter measures were put in place to prevent plastic from entering the fort and to keep the area clean for future visitors to enjoy

name: SOURAV MUKUL TEWARI
review_text:
Golkonda Fort in Hyderabad is an architectural marvel and a testament to India's rich history, sprawling across an impressive expanse of around 11 kilometers. This fort, originally constructed under the Kakatiya dynasty, showcases the resilient spirit of Hindu rulers who built it as a defensive stronghold. The majestic fort stands as a monument to India's heritage, though it was later taken over by Muslim rulers who expanded and fortified it, utilizing Golkonda's strategic position and rich resources.

The fort's design is an intriguing blend of Hindu architectural styles, with impressive gateways, sprawling courtyards, and towering walls. The engineering brilliance here is notable, especially in the acoustics of the Fateh Darwaza (Victory Gate), where even the slightest sound at the entrance can be heard atop the fort. Climbing to the top, however, is no small feat, requiring visitors to ascend thousands of steps to reach a beautiful temple that crowns the fort.

For a well-rounded experience, visitors can explore stalls that sell refreshments, though it's wise to carry cash since digital payments are not accepted. The fort is surrounded by beautifully maintained gardens, providing a serene break amidst the ancient stone structures.

A must-see attraction is the sound and light show held in the evening, which narrates the fort's history and draws many tourists. Outside the fort, a range of restaurants offers an array of cuisines, catering to the needs of visitors. Visiting Golkonda Fort is a mesmerizing journey through time, blending the allure of India's past with its breathtaking surroundings.
Visited on
Weekday

name: Anilkumar Karimbanakkal
review_text:
Golconda Fort is a true marvel that bridges centuries of history, architecture, and a rich cultural legacy on the western edge of Hyderabad. Originally founded in the 11th century by Kakatiya ruler Prataparudra as a mud fort, Golcondas transformation over time is nothing short of legendary. From humble beginnings, it rose to be a formidable citadel under the Bahmani Sultanate, and later the capital of the Qutb Shahi dynasty, with towering granite walls, intricate bastions, and a legacy as a diamond trading hub renowned worldwide. Its name, meaning Cowherd's Hill in Telugu, only hints at the remarkable journey this fortress has taken through history.

Walking through the fort, you're surrounded by layers of architectural splendor--from the grand Fateh Darwaza, with iron-spiked gates and its famous acoustics, to the intricate Bala Hissar Gate adorned with peacocks and mythical yalis that echo Hindu origins. Every structure within--from royal chambers and mosques to ancient stables--tells a story of its past grandeur. The acoustics are nothing short of an engineering marvel; a single clap at Fateh Darwaza reverberates all the way up to Bala Hisar, a warning feature used to alert the fort in times of attack.

The fort's cultural and religious harmony is beautifully preserved in its temples, mosques, and tombs. The Jagadamba Temple, a revered site during Bonalu, and the Mahankali Temple, nestled within the fort, bear witness to its enduring spiritual significance. Meanwhile, the Qutb Shahi tombs, just outside the fort, stand as serene monuments to Golcondas rulers, merging Islamic architectural elegance with natural beauty.

Each visit to Golconda has been a captivating experience, deepened by the mesmerizing laser show in the evening, which breathes life into the fort's history. The show, artfully narrated, takes you back to a time when Hyderabad's foundations were laid, revealing tales of valor, ambition, and artistry that shaped the Deccan.

In every stone, Golconda Fort holds secrets of ancient dynasties, trade, and craftsmanship. It stands as both a memory and a monument, a place that never fails to leave me awestruck, no matter how often I visit. A timeless testament to Hyderabad's past, it's a must-visit for anyone seeking to step into the pages of history itself.
Visited on
Weekday

name: Abi Paul sunil
review_text:
Visiting Golkonda Fort, located near Hyderabad, is an enriching journey into history. This massive fortress, once the capital of the Qutb Shahi dynasty, is known for its majestic architecture, intricate gateways, and fascinating acoustics.

The fort is spread across a large area with various structures such as the Fateh Darwaza (Victory Gate), royal palaces, mosques, and several bastions. Each structure tells a story, offering a glimpse into the forts strategic design. The steps leading up to the top might be a bit challenging, but they are worth it for the stunning panoramic view of Hyderabad from the highest point.

One of the most remarkable features is its unique acoustic system. You can hear claps from the entrance echoing at the highest point of the fort, which was historically used to alert the guards of an impending attack. This detail always fascinates visitors and demonstrates the skill of ancient architects.

A must-see experience is the evening sound and light show, which narrates the forts history and gives visitors a deeper appreciation of its significance. However, be prepared for crowds, especially on weekends and during holidays. A visit to Golkonda Fort is best enjoyed with comfortable shoes, water, and a good camera to capture the views.

In short, Golkonda Fort is an impressive blend of history, architecture, and scenic beauty, making it a memorable visit for history enthusiasts, photographers, and anyone curious about Indias cultural heritage.
Visited on
Public holiday

No wait

Reservation recommended

name: Naveen Nair
review_text:
I recently visited Golconda fort, and my god it was an experience. The architecture is magnificent and its especially brilliant when u realise it was built so long ago as it was definitely very ahead of its time. The sound and echo effect is something we have never experienced before and its simply flabbergasting that it was built centuries ago. However the only downside was that some of the indoor rooms are very dark and have hence inhabited hundreds of bats, when you enter these rooms they have the most foul and nasty smell ever. Other than this it was a very enjoyable experience and the climb at the end was tiring but fun which led to a breathtaking view. Would definitely recommend it if you like a good trek

name: sripardha vagira
review_text:
Historical place to visit in Hyderabad once . The fort has nearly 1000 years history and it is the unique place where you will see Kaktaiya culture and Nizams culture.You can have the view of the Hyderabad from the top of the fort. Darbar hall, Ramadasu jail , Mahankali temple are some special attractions.There is a Mahankali temple on the top which is one of the oldest temple in telangana.It will take more than 2 hours to complete the entire fort. Its advisable to go early as the place will get crowded from afternoon.

name: RamanJ Reddy
review_text:
Nice tourist place for an evening, suggest avoid weekends and public holidays as there is a heavy footfall in the area. Parking is generally not a problem at other times. Traffic can get congested at times, so either hire an auto or taxi, or get an experienced driver. The best time is generally around sunset, reaching around 4 - 4.30 pm allows you decent time to take pics, walk up the fort, take in the sunset and watch the sound and light show if interested.

name: Keerthi Krishna Sai
review_text:
Located in the western part of Hyderabad, the Golconda Fort was originally known as Mankal and was built in 1143. It started as a mud fort under the rule of the Rajah of Warangal and was later fortified by the Bahmani Sultans and the Qutub Shahi dynasty between the 14th and 17th centuries. The inner fort contains the remains of palaces, mosques, and a hilltop pavilion that offers a view of other buildings.

name: Miki
review_text:
Golconda Fort's appeal during golden hours--when the soft light of sunrise or sunset washes over its historic walls--has led some visitors to compare its tranquil beauty to that of Amsterdam, with its serene, expansive views. The fort's peaceful ambiance and photogenic quality make it a great spot for photography, particularly around these times. There's a section of the fort that gives off Mediterranean vibes, reminiscent of Greece, with white stone structures and open spaces that add to the sense of escape.

The fort also offers a mild trekking experience, perfect for those looking for a short adventure without leaving the city. The trek up, combined with the breathtaking view from the top, enhances the feeling of having stepped into another world

When visiting Golconda Fort, it's a good idea to carry some change for purchasing tickets, especially since the entry fees are quite minimal (15 for locals and 200 for foreign tourists). Additionally, if you plan to take the sound and light show or carry a camera, extra charges may apply . Since the climb to the top involves many steps and can be physically demanding, especially under the sun, it's also advisable to bring water to stay hydrated during your visit  .

name: Diksha Verma
review_text:
The fort is also famous for its unique acoustic system, where sounds from the entrance can be heard at the highest point of the fort. Its a fascinating piece of engineering that adds to the allure of the place. I would highly recommend taking a guided tour to fully appreciate the history and significance of the fort.

The entire complex is clean and well-maintained, and theres plenty of signage to guide you along the way. Visiting during the evening is a bonus, as the light and sound show adds an extra layer of magic to the experience.

name: nisha pant
review_text:
The area around the Fort is very busy and crowded, with narrow roads packed with traffic. It can feel a bit overwhelming, but once you get there and enter the Fort, you'll see that all the trouble is worth it.

You can hire a guide if you want to learn more about the history and stories of the Fort. The view from the top is absolutely breathtaking, but the climb can be tough. Just take your time, rest when you need to, and enjoy the amazing sights from up high. You won't regret it!

name: Dr Adarsh Padiyar
review_text:
Golconda fort is a excellent place to visit and know the history of qutb Shahi dynasty
Ticket price is 25rs
I suggest that it is better if you first watch the video about Golconda fort on youtube and then visit
You will be able to appreciate many things after knowing about it before
Wonderful experience
Suggest that you go to washroom before entering fort complex
Take a break in between if you are tired climbing
But worth going once
Memorable experience

name: Dhyuti Deepu
review_text:
Recently visited the iconic Golconda fort and this is my honest review
ASI has hired incompetent people as security and they don't know the basic duty on why they are there
Please do the following ASI
Please maintain the cleanliness inside the fort
Plastics and garbage are dumped everywhere
Directions must be put at required places
Places which are infested by bats and pigeons must be cordoned off so that people don't go there as their is possibility of H2S gas formation and it is quite dangerous
Security person on duty must prevent graffiti
Water points must be marked
Please do the needful

name: Deepak Thirumurugan
review_text:
It's a huge fort with beautiful architecture, although some parts of the fort has been destroyed over time the main structure remains intact.
You can buy tickets directly at the site by both counter tickets ( cash only, no UPI ) and there will be a QR code where you can scan and buy the tickets instantly online.
Tickets cost 20 INR per person for adults and children go free.
Please note this is not for pregnant women , elders , those with cardiac issues , mobility issues and whoever can't climb steps.
There are roughly 400 steps to climb and they are stone steps with uneven layout. Avoid wearing sandals with heels.
It's a long climb to the top , where you can get a great view of the Hyderabad City.
Beware there are bats inside some parts of the fort although they are harmless there will be some foul smell.
Visited on
Weekend

Wait time
Up to 10 min

Reservation recommended

name: Saravanaperumal Chidambaram
review_text:
Once a kingdom now it is under ruins. Such a huge fort with all required places like garden, market, place for funeral, horse / camel stable, well, area for washing clothes, ammunition storage and temple etc. Our imagination moves to older days and mind thinks about how kings roamed here, how this place would have been. ASI is holding the fort to keep the place clean and tidy I could see people throwing garbage inside the fort. Historical place for school kids and they would enjoy it. Plan your visits on winter as it would be hotter and difficult to navigate during sunny season.

Weekday

name: guru Acharya
review_text:
It's a beautiful heritage fort to see and experience the vast landscape of the fort , but unfortunately the experience as a tourist ruined my visit. The entire fort steps till the top is filled with trash, plastic, paan spits, food waste .
Don't know why there is no maintenance team taking care of such a heritage sight, I really felt ashamed when the foreign tourists next to me commenting about our people. I sincerely request the government or a department which is taking care of the fort to sincerely take care of the cleanliness of the premises. Jai Hind

Golconda was the principal capital of the Qutub Shahi kings. The inner fort contains ruins of palaces, mosques and a hill top pavilion, which rises about 130 meters high and gives a birds eye view of other buildings. Golconda fort is undoubtedly one of most magnificent fortress complexes in India and all times my favourite quintal of memorable moments connected with this place.

name: HARI SHANKAR
review_text:
## Golkonda Fort: A Fortress of History and Beauty

**A Journey Through Time**

Today, I had the opportunity to explore the majestic Golkonda Fort in Hyderabad. Despite the lack of well-maintained government buses, the journey was well worth it. Upon arriving at the fort, I easily booked my entry ticket online using the QR code provided and entered through the grand main gate.

**A Fortress of History and Architecture**

**A Tapestry of History**

Golkonda Fort, a magnificent citadel perched atop a granite hill, stands as a testament to Hyderabads rich heritage. Its history dates back to the 12th century when it was a small mud fort built by the Kakatiya ruler Prataparudra.

In the 14th century, the Bahmani Sultans fortified Golconda and made it a strategic military outpost. It later became the capital of the Qutub Shahi dynasty, who ruled the region from the 16th to the 17th centuries. Under the Qutub Shahis, Golconda witnessed its golden age, renowned for its trade in precious stones, particularly diamonds. The famous Koh-i-Noor diamond, once the largest known diamond in the world, was discovered in the Golconda mines.

The forts strategic importance and its vast wealth made it a target for invaders. In 1687, Mughal Emperor Aurangzeb besieged Golconda for eight months before capturing it. The fall of Golconda marked the end of the Qutub Shahi rule and the beginning of Mughal dominance in the region.

Over the centuries, Golconda has faced neglect and decay. However, recent restoration efforts have helped preserve its historical significance. Today, the fort stands as a symbol of Hyderabads glorious past, attracting visitors from around the world.
The fort is a treasure trove of history, architecture, and natural beauty. As I wandered through the sprawling complex, I was captivated by the intricate carvings, towering walls, and lush gardens. The informative boards provided detailed insights into the forts history and the various structures within its boundaries.

**A Hike to the Summit**

One of the highlights of my visit was the hike to the top of the fort. The climb was challenging but rewarding, offering breathtaking panoramic views of Hyderabad. The temple at the summit provided a serene atmosphere, and I couldnt resist taking countless photos of the stunning scenery.

**Facilities and Amenities**

The fort is well-equipped with facilities for visitors. There are ample restrooms, drinking water stations, and dustbins throughout the complex. Security guards are present to ensure safety, and guides are available to provide additional information. For those seeking refreshments, there are food and beverage options available.

**A Must-Visit Destination**

Golkonda Fort is a must-visit destination for anyone interested in history, architecture, or simply seeking a day out in nature. The forts rich history, stunning views, and well-maintained facilities make it a truly memorable experience.

**Hashtag Suggestions:**

#GolkondaFort #Hyderabad #History #Architecture #Travel #India #MustVisit #Fortress #Tourism #Adventure #ExploreHyderabad #Telangana #IndianHeritage #TravelGram #InstaTravel

name: Navinya A
review_text:
I recently visited Golkonda Fort, and it was an incredible experience! The fort is rich in history, with stunning architecture and well-preserved structures that give you a glimpse into the grandeur of its past. The views from the top are breathtaking, offering a panoramic view of Hyderabad. The climb to the top can be a bit steep, but its totally worth it once you reach the summit.

The fort is also famous for its unique acoustic system, where sounds from the entrance can be heard at the highest point of the fort. Its a fascinating piece of engineering that adds to the allure of the place. I would highly recommend taking a guided tour to fully appreciate the history and significance of the fort.

The entire complex is clean and well-maintained, and theres plenty of signage to guide you along the way. Visiting during the evening is a bonus, as the light and sound show adds an extra layer of magic to the experience.

**Recommendations:**
- **Arrive Early**: The fort can get crowded, especially on weekends. Arriving early in the morning will give you a more peaceful experience and cooler weather for the climb.
- **Wear Comfortable Shoes**: There's a lot of walking and climbing involved, so be sure to wear comfortable shoes.
- **Carry Water and Snacks**: The climb is quite tiring, and there aren't many shops inside the fort, so bringing your own water and light snacks is a good idea.
- **Take a Guide**: A guided tour is highly recommended to understand the historical significance and stories behind the fort's architecture and engineering marvels.
- **Plan for the Light and Sound Show**: If possible, stay for the evening show. Its a wonderful way to end your visit and learn more about the history in an engaging way.

If youre in Hyderabad, Golkonda Fort is a must-visit destination!
Visited on
Weekend

name: Richard Jones
review_text:
Lovely place and should not be missed while at Hyderabad.

The architecture of bygone years really makes us wonder how did these people do such great things with minimum tools and technology.

The place is well maintained and navigation is easy. Climbing to the last point is a challenge but can be done. Carry sufficient water as you need to hydrate yourself while on this trek as it's really hot outside.

I would also advice visitors to wear masks especially while going beneath the caves or rocks or lower height structures as the smell of bats and pigeon urine and fecal matter really stink the place.

Please go for it and enjoy the place and do not throw trash and keep the place clean

name: Susheel Kumar
review_text:
The Golconda fort is one of the ancient landmark of Hyderabad state and is one the archeological site of India.
It is on the south west of Hyderabad city and get a great view of west and central Hyd if you climb the fort.
The Golconda forts celebrates telanganas Biggest festival Bonalu with a great ease. The first day of bonalu starts here and holds for total of 7 weeks .
The entry is free on bonalu day and it is must visit during that day to experience the culture and heritage of Hyderabad.
I must say it is also one of the most visited place in hyd by tourists and it holds a good position in tourism.
A good weather could help us to explore this place even more 
Visited on
Weekend

Wait time
Up to 10 min

Reservation recommended
No

name: sanjay k j
review_text:
Located in Hyderabad, India, Golconda Fort is a magnificent monument that showcases the rich history and architectural prowess of the Qutb Shahi dynasty. This 13th-century fort is a must-visit destination for history enthusiasts, architecture buffs, and anyone fascinated by the grandeur of Indias past.

Pros:

Imposing Architecture: The forts imposing structure, with its rugged granite walls and majestic gates, is awe-inspiring.
Rich History: Golconda Fort has played a significant role in Indian history, serving as the capital of the Qutb Shahi kingdom.
Stunning Views: The fort offers breathtaking views of the surrounding city and the lush green surroundings.
Well-Maintained: The fort is well-maintained, with clean surroundings and amenities for visitors.
Guided Tours: Knowledgeable guides provide insightful information about the forts history and significance.

Cons:

Crowded: The fort can get crowded, especially during peak season.
Steep Climbs: The forts uneven terrain and steep climbs can be challenging for some visitors.
Limited Amenities: While the fort has basic amenities, options for food and refreshments are limited.

Learn about the legendary diamond, said to have been mined in the nearby hills.
Explore the beautifully crafted tombs of the Qutb Shahi rulers.
Witness the incredible acoustic system, where a handclap at the entrance can be heared at top.
Golconda Fort is an unmissable destination for anyone interested in history, architecture, or culture. Its grandeur, beauty, and significance make it a truly unforgettable experience.

Recommended for:

- History enthusiasts
- Architecture buffs
- Culture lovers
- Families
- Solo travelers

Not recommended for:

- Those with mobility issues (due to steep climbs)
- Young children (due to uneven terrain)

name: Bharath Raj
review_text:
One of best Historical place to visit in Hyderabad....
Old fort with great memorable achievements

Golconda Fort, located near Hyderabad, India, is a remarkable historical structure renowned for its impressive architecture and advanced engineering. Built in the 12th century by the Kakatiya dynasty, the fort was later expanded by the Qutb Shahi kings in the 16th century. Its name, derived from the Telugu words Golla Konda meaning Shepherds Hill, signifies its humble beginnings.

The fort is perched on a ridge, offering panoramic views of the surrounding landscape. It features exquisite acoustic technology; whispers can be heard from one end to another due to its unique construction. The fort's massive granite walls walls stretch over 10 kilometers, enclosing a series of palaces, temples, and royal quarters.

Golconda is famous for its diamond trade, as it was once the capital of the Golconda Sultanate, known for some of the worlds most renowned diamonds, including the Koh-i-Noor. Visitors today can explore the remnants of its sprawling complexes, impressive gates, and the stunning Nazri Bagh gardens.

Recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, Golconda Fort remains a significant cultural landmark, reflecting the rich history and architectural prowess of medieval India while attracting tourists and history enthusiasts alike.
Visited on
Weekday

No wait

Reservation recommended

name: Shammi Viren
review_text:
This architectural marvel stands as a testament to the brilliance of ancient Indian engineering and the grandeur of the Qutb Shahi dynasty. The fort's sprawling structure, with its massive ramparts, intricately designed gates, and lush surroundings, offers a fascinating journey through history.

The view from the top is breathtaking, providing a panoramic vista of Hyderabad. Whether you're a history enthusiast or a casual traveler, the sheer scale and beauty of Golconda will leave you in awe. I highly recommend the evening light and sound show, which brings the fort's rich history to life in a captivating manner.

Golconda Fort is a must-visit for anyone looking to experience Hyderabad's rich cultural heritage. Be prepared for a lot of walking and carry water to stay hydrated, but every step is worth it!

name: Abdul Kadir
review_text:
My visit to Golconda Fort was nothing short of amazing! The fort's grandeur and historical significance are truly captivating. As I explored the vast complex, I was awestruck by the remarkable architecture and the intricate details that have stood the test of time. The climb to the top offers a stunning panoramic view of Hyderabad, making it worth the effort. The acoustic marvels, such as the clap echo at the entrance, are fascinating and a testament to the engineering of the era.

The fort is well-maintained, and there's so much history to absorb, from its role in the region's defense to its connection with the famous Kohinoor diamond. I'd recommend going in the evening to catch the light and sound show, which adds another dimension to the experience. Golconda Fort is a must-visit for anyone interested in history and architecture!

name: A Chathur Ganapathy
review_text:
One of the most important and popular historical monuments in Hyderabad. The fort is open to public entry until 6pm post which entry isn't allowed. It's a definite must visit location,suggested timings would be around 4pm and ensure you get a guide for the whole trip around the fort. Don't cheap out and take just half visit,trust me it's worth it.
Stay until 7pm wherein you can watch the laser show and historical short documentary about the fort and history of the area,the ticket is 140 per person.
Overall it's a really great monument to visit and learn around.There's a lot of walking and the sun is quite rough so ensure you carry enough water and wear a big hat/cap.

A truly unforgettable experience in Hyderabads crown jewel.

name: Gunjan Panara
review_text:
Guide: A guide is a must if youre seeking to explore the history of Hyderabads dynasties. Need to pay up to 800.

Time: 3 hours approx.

Things to Carry: Water bottle is must. It is good to have a Torch to enjoy dark areas in the fort and a Binocular can help you to see the surroundings of Hyderabad.

Packaged Snacks and Water bottle available inside the fort campus.

Caution: No Parking space in surroundings.

name: Jeeva Payyappat
review_text:
Golconda Fort was a center of flourishing trade, culture, and politics in the Deccan region. Today, Golconda Fort is a popular tourist destination and a symbol of Hyderabad's rich cultural heritage.
The fort is famous for its acoustic marvels, where clapping at the entrance can be heard at the highest point of the fort, serving as a warning system against intruders.

name: Ankit Tamrakar
review_text:
One of the best places to visit if you are in Hyderabad. It has a very old structure which has come through dynasties and has faced all the attacks.

You get a beautiful panoramic view of Hyderabad city from the top.

You should have more than 3 hours, to visit the fort complete as it is very big. You need to climb more than 300 steps to reach the top.

Various facilities like toilets and drinking water are there. Also one tea/coffee shop there. Overall, the fort was clean.

There is a light and sound show at 7 pm in the fort.

name: SARATH (Solo traveler)
review_text:
I recently had the pleasure of visiting Golconda Fort in Hyderabad, and it was an unforgettable experience. This historical site, renowned for its architectural grandeur and rich history, is a must-visit for anyone traveling to the city.

As I approached the fort, the sheer size of the stone walls was impressive. The fort, built in the 12th century, covers a vast area and offers stunning views of the surrounding landscape. The initial walk through the entrance set the tone, filled with anticipation and intrigue.

Once inside, I took my time exploring the various structures, from the majestic gates to the ancient palaces. Each corner revealed a story, showcasing the fort's strategic importance during the rule of the Qutb Shahi dynasty. The acoustics within the fort are particularly fascinating; the sound of a clap at the entrance can be heard at the top of the fort, demonstrating the architectural ingenuity of the builders.

Don't miss the climb to the main citadel, which provides panoramic vistas of the city and surrounding hills. The sunset view from this vantage point was breathtaking, with the fiery colors contrasting against the rugged rocks of the fort. Make sure to have your camera ready!

The fort also houses several notable structures, including the majestic Durbar Hall and the beautiful mosque. Each site is well-preserved, allowing visitors to appreciate the intricate designs and craftsmanship of the time. The well-maintained gardens provide a lovely spot to rest and take in the beauty of the surroundings.

Guided tours are available, and I highly recommend opting for one. The knowledgeable guides shared interesting anecdotes and historical facts, making the visit more enriching.

One thing to consider is the timing of your visit. Early morning or late afternoon is ideal to avoid the heat, especially during summer months. Ensure you wear comfortable shoes, as exploring the fort involves quite a bit of walking and climbing.

Overall, Golconda Fort is a remarkable testament to India's history and architecture. My visit was both educational and inspiring, a perfect blend of culture, history, and natural beauty. I left with a deep appreciation for its historical significance and a desire to return. Highly recommended!

Weekday

name: Vaibhav J
review_text:
Magnificient historic monument. The fort and the surrounding area is very beautiful.

They have placards in a few places to inform the visitors about the history, there should be a lot of more though. The place is huge, and to go to the top you have to climb around 360 steps.
There are multiple paths to go to the top, and a few shady areas to rest in between. There is a durga temple at the top, which is also very pretty. So bring some water, they also have drinking water at a few points inside. The view from top is splendid, you get to see the whole city, modern buildings beside old architecture. Maintenance is okay, some places can be improved a lot.

The only thing we didnt like was the behaviour of other visitors. On many of the walls people have engraved their names, etc. which is disgusting. How can people see a monument and think that they should scribe their names on it!! This is after the ASI has already put up signs asking visitors not to damage the historical place. Any way, this has nothing to do with the place itself, it is the stupid people who come and damage such a beautiful monument. People have thrown bottles, food packets etc. in several places. The good thing is that these are limited to a few places only, leaving the majority of the fort in good condition. We even saw a man urinating beside a wall, useless idiots having no respect for history should not be visting such places. They should either have CCTVs installed or have more security people around the place.

In conclusion, the place is beautiful and definitely worth a visit. Even more so if you love history. Our favourites were the nagina baag, the durga temple, the top most structure, and the ruins all around the fort.

name: Scott
review_text:
Highly recommended destination if you are visiting Hyderabad. Others have written excellent reviews so I will focus on items relevant to someone visiting from outside India (I am from the US).

There is a different price for non-locals. At the time I was there, it was 200 rupees. Would HIGHLY recommend getting a guide. Paid 500 rupees a person for the group I was with. You will pay at the end and you should also consider tipping as the tour fee will not go directly to your guide. There will be two options: long or short. Long includes the steps, short does not. It was about 1+ hours for the short tour. In addition to learning about the history, the guide will point out great photo spots and will take your picture.

Signage is in English. There is a refreshment area, but I did not see what was for sale. Also toilets near the end of the tour.

Also a light show in the evening, but I was there mid-day so cannot assess.

Was there during the week, no line to get in.

name: Suchi Choudhary
review_text:
The fort has its own charm . You must visit it with great energy as to roam around the entire fort you may climb around 300-700 stairs. People with severe leg pain may choose to avoid visiting this place. It is not necessary to climb all the way up. You can return in between also. The government needs to mark more exit guidelines as people may find difficulties in finding the exit route. It would be good to get a booklet if not taking a guide. Currently guide charges are Rs.750/. Make sure you carry water, as even though there were sign boards for drinking water, I could not find it to refill my bottle. I could only buy a bottle in the shop when I was almost near the exit.

name: vitikrater
review_text:
I was here on my own during the day and didnt regret it. It is a very spacious area that is visited by a lot of people, but there are also quiet corners if you dont rush straight to the top. Its no problem to travel here without a guide. Great views over the city!
(And of course, as a Western tourist you are also extremely exotic here and are often approached and asked for photos.)
Visited on
Weekday

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
No
review_translated_text:
Ich war tagsuber auf eigene Faust hier und habe es nicht bereut. Es ist eine sehr weitlaufige Anlage, die zwar von vielen Menschen besucht wird, aber es gibt auch ruhige Ecken, wenn man nicht direkt nach ganz oben stromt. Kein Problem ist es, hier ohne Guide unterwegs zu sein. Tolle Blicke uber die Stadt!

(Und naturlich ist man auch hier als westlicher Tourist extremer Exot und wird oft angesprochen und es werden Fotos gewunscht.)

name: Random Stuffs with RRD
review_text:
An ancient diamond trading center of the world. It was built during the Kakatiya dynasty. It has a steep climb and once youre at the top you can get a clear view of Hyderabad City on all sides.

The Golconda fort is known for the famous Golconda diamonds that were traded here due to its proximity to Golconda and Kollur mines.

The Koh-i-Noor, The Idols eye, Daria-i-Noor, Jacob diamond are some prominent ones.

name: Sachin Salunke
review_text:
Golconda Fort - A Must-Visit



Golconda Fort is an impressive historical site in Hyderabad, offering stunning views, fascinating architecture, and rich history. The acoustic engineering is amazing--clap at the main gate, and its heard at the top! Famous for its diamond trade, the fort is a must for history lovers. Wear comfy shoes for the climb, and don't miss the evening light and sound show for an immersive experience. Highly recommended!

Weekday

name: Rohan Yadav
review_text:
Online ticket is available.
Parking also available for cars,bikes and buses.
Carry water bottle and handkerchief with you cuz it takes much time to climb the fort.
Experience is mesmerising as you can see whole Hyderabad from there
Qutub Shahi tombs,hitech city, charminar etc.
Just dont stand around corners for safety.
There are gaurds who will prevent you from doing this.
Must visit place in hyd.
Mandirs are there inside.
And a metal of 250kg thats very tough to lift.

name: Shifa Aymal
review_text:
Visiting Golconda Fort was an incredible journey into the past! The fort's imposing structure, with its well-preserved walls and towers, offers a glimpse into the rich history and strategic significance it once held. Walking through the fort's courtyards, tunnels, and battlements, I could almost feel the stories of ancient battles and the people who lived here. The museum inside was full of fascinating artifacts and detailed displays, giving deeper insight into the fort's history. The panoramic views from the top were breathtaking, offering a perfect spot for photos. Whether you're a history buff or simply looking for an impressive landmark, this fort is definitely worth the visit!

Weekend

name: Bappaditya Mishra
review_text:
Golconda Fort in Hyderabad is a remarkable testament to the grandeur of bygone eras. Nestled in Khair Complex, Ibrahim Bagh, this historical fortress offers an awe-inspiring experience. The fort's imposing structure and sprawling battlements provide a fascinating glimpse into the architectural brilliance of the past.

Walking through the fort, you're immediately struck by the intricate details of its design, from the impressive gates and majestic walls to the exquisite acoustics in the Fateh Darwaza. The panoramic views from the top are nothing short of spectacular, offering a breathtaking view of Hyderabads skyline.

The fort is well-preserved and maintained, with informative signs that provide context about its rich history. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, enhancing the overall experience. Early morning or late afternoon visits are ideal to avoid the midday heat and to witness the fort's beauty in the softer light.

Golconda Fort is a must-visit for history enthusiasts, architecture aficionados, and anyone interested in exploring Hyderabads cultural heritage. The fort's grandeur and historical significance make it a memorable destination. Highly recommended!
Visited on
Weekday

name: Shahzaib vikhar
review_text:
Golconda Fort in Hyderabad is a captivating historical site that offers a fascinating glimpse into the regions past. The fort, known for its impressive architecture and strategic significance, stands on a hill and provides stunning panoramic views of the city and surrounding landscape.

Exploring Golconda Fort reveals a labyrinth of grandiose ruins, including massive walls, ancient gates, and the remnants of palaces and temples. The acoustics in the fort are remarkable; a clap at the base can be heard at the top, which is an interesting feature for visitors.

While the forts historical allure is undeniable, be prepared for a bit of a climb to reach the higher vantage points. The site can get quite hot, so its best to visit early in the morning or later in the afternoon to avoid the midday sun. Overall, Golconda Fort is a must-visit for history enthusiasts and anyone interested in experiencing Hyderabads rich cultural heritage.

name: Mehul Gosalia
review_text:
This ancient fort has a lot of science in it, especially how sound travels. Its not the echo I am talking about, if u whisper to the wall, other person standing diagonally 4o feet apart, close to another pillar can listen to the whisper clearly. Do take a guide, they have fixed charges. I paid 1000/- for the entire Fort visit and I felt completely satisfied paying that money.

The view after reaching the top is mesmerizing. One can also find Maa Kali mandir after reaching the top.. you can give it a try if u like visiting historical places.

name: Sandeep Baliga
review_text:
Certainly! Golconda Fort, also known as Golkonda, is a remarkable citadel with a rich history. Here are some fascinating facts about it:

1. **Origins and Name**:
- Golconda, originally called Mankal, was built by the Kakatiya rulers in the 13th century.
- Legend has it that a shepherd boy found an idol on the hill, leading to the construction of a mud fort around it1.

2. **Acoustic Wonders**:
- Golconda Fort is famous for its acoustic effects. Clapping at specific points can be heard at the top of the hill (Raj Darbar).
- These acoustic features served as a security measure during its time3.

3. **Diamonds and Treasures**:
- The fort housed a vault where the Koh-i-Noor and Hope diamonds were once stored, along with other precious gems.
- Many renowned diamonds, including Daria-i-Noor, Noor-ul-Ain, and the Regent Diamond, were believed to have been excavated from Golcondas mines1.

4. **Communication Systems**:
- The Qutb Shahi rulers established an intricate network of sound and light-based communication systems within the fort.
- These systems allowed rapid transmission of messages across long distances, including the famous clapping portico4.

5. **Massive Walls and Gates**:
- Golconda Fort stands on a 400-feet-high hill and boasts massive walls, approximately 12 meters in height.
- Eight entrance gates played a significant role in medieval history3.

6. **Naya Qila (New Fort)**:
- Naya Qila, an extension of Golconda Fort, features towers and the ancient Hatiyan ka Jhad (Elephant-sized tree), a baobab tree with an enormous girth.
- The forts huge gates are adorned with large pointed iron spikes to prevent elephants from damaging them1.

name: Viinoj Suurendran
review_text:
Golconda Fort is a breathtaking architectural marvel that showcases the grandeur of Indias rich history. Located in Hyderabad, this 13th-century fort is a must-visit attraction for anyone interested in history, architecture, or simply exploring the countrys cultural heritage.

As I walked through the forts imposing gates, I was struck by the sheer scale and intricate design of the structures. The forts walls, towers, and palaces are a testament to the ingenuity and craftsmanship of the Kakatiya and Qutb Shahi dynasties that once ruled from here.

The acoustic effects of the forts architecture are particularly impressive, with whispers echoing across the halls and corridors. The stunning views of the surrounding landscape from the top of the fort are a bonus.

name: Deepak Sheoran
review_text:
It is a remarkable architectural masterpiece and an important historical monument in Hyderabad, India. The fort was constructed in the 13th century and underwent several renovations over the years. Its intricate system of water supply and communication systems is impressive.

During my visit in December at Golconda Fort, I learned that the fort features various buildings and structures, such as the grand mosque, the Royal Palace, and the Durbar Hall, that visitors are explore & enjoyed. The forts grand entrance, designed with multiple gates and walls, was built to protect it from invaders. Climbing to the top of the fort provides breathtaking views of the surrounding area, including the city of Hyderabad.

In my opinion, the Golconda Fort is a significant piece of history that everyone should visit. The forts remarkable architecture reminded me of the Nizam rule, which adds to its cultural significance. It is a rare site in todays world that provides a glimpse into the past and showcases the engineering and architectural skills of that era.

Another highlight of the fort is the fantastic view from the top, which makes the visit even more memorable. Moreover, the ticket price of only 20 per person makes the visit affordable and accessible to everyone.

Overall, the Golconda Fort is a must-visit destination in Hyderabad that offers a fascinating blend of history, culture, and architecture.

name: Ritambhari M
review_text: One of the main tourist attractions of Hyderabad, Golconda Fort offers a glimpse into the citys history. Climbing all the way to the top can be arduous, yet its worth the climb for once there, one can get a view of the entire area surrounding the fort. Its amazing how the architect designed the fort that a clap at the bottom of the fort can be heard at the top of the fort. In days when there were no cranes, no modern equipment, it is amazing to note how many little things were taken care of before building such a vast structure.

name: Shashwat
review_text:
Bijapur and Golconda were two prominent Deccan Sultanates in South India during the medieval period, both of which played significant roles in the regions history, culture, and architecture.

**Bijapur** was the capital of the Adil Shahi dynasty, founded in 1490 by Yusuf Adil Shah. The city became a major cultural center under the Adil Shahis, known for its blend of Persian, Turkish, and Indian influences. Bijapur is renowned for its magnificent architectural monuments, particularly the **Gol Gumbaz**, which is the mausoleum of Muhammad Adil Shah and one of the largest domed structures in the world. The city also boasts the Ibrahim Rauza, a splendid tomb and mosque complex, often considered an architectural masterpiece. Under the Adil Shahis, Bijapur flourished as a center of learning, arts, and Sufi culture.

**Golconda**, originally a fortress town, became the capital of the Qutb Shahi dynasty in the early 16th century. The Qutb Shahis were great patrons of Persianate culture, art, and architecture. Golconda is famous for its massive fort, which is an engineering marvel with its complex system of gates, walls, and acoustics. The forts Bala Hissar Gate, Taramati Mosque, and the intricate Fateh Rahben cannon reflect the citys rich heritage. Additionally, Golconda was historically significant as a major center of diamond trade, with the region producing some of the worlds most famous diamonds, including the Koh-i-Noor and the Hope Diamond.

Both Bijapur and Golconda were eventually annexed by the Mughal Empire in the late 17th century under Emperor Aurangzeb. Despite their eventual decline, these cities remain symbols of the cultural and architectural grandeur of the Deccan Sultanates. Their legacy continues to influence the regions identity and heritage.

name: suraz roy
review_text:
Golconda Fort is a magnificent fortress located in Hyderabad, Telangana, India. It was the capital of the Qutb Shahi dynasty, which ruled the region from 1518 to 1687. Heres a brief history:

- 12th century: The fort was initially built by the Kakatiya dynasty as a mud fort.
- 14th century: The Qutb Shahi dynasty took over and expanded the fort, using granite and stone.
- 1518-1687: Golconda served as the capital of the Qutb Shahi kingdom, which was known for its architectural, cultural, and commercial achievements.
- 1591: The fort was expanded and fortified by Sultan Muhammad Quli Qutb Shah, who built the outer wall and the Fateh Darwaza (Victory Gate).
- 1687: The Mughal Empire, led by Aurangzeb, besieged and captured Golconda after a nine-month siege, marking the end of the Qutb Shahi dynasty.
- 18th-19th centuries: The fort was occupied by various rulers, including the Nizams of Hyderabad.
- 20th century: Golconda Fort was neglected and left to ruin.
- Present day: The fort is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a popular tourist destination, known for its stunning architecture, intricate carvings, and historical significance.

Would you like to know more about Golconda Forts architecture, legends, or tourist information?

Weekend

name: Sheashaanth Ganapathy
review_text:
I went with my friends.
That day when we reached the fort, it started raining heavily as soon as we stepped out of the car. So we bought big umbrellas and got the ticket 25/person and started walking in the rain. The view was very nice as soon as we reached the top. Took lot of photos.
But as soon as we started descending the clouds cleared and sun started shining. Thats when we realised it rained only to help us, coz if hadnt rained we all would have been drained.

I recommend to carry umbrella, cap with you.... Rain or sun.... Umbrella and cap will help you.
Climbing in Sunny weather is more difficult than climbing in rain.

Only drawback is the bad smell coming from the cave like paths. Its so bad , we all have to hold our breath till crossing that area.

name: sai kumar koratala
review_text:
Golconda Fort is a historic fortress in Hyderabad, built by the Kakatiyas and expanded by the Qutb Shahi dynasty. Its known for its impressive architecture, strong defense system, unique acoustics, and as a hub for diamond trade. The forts history includes a famous siege by Mughal emperor Aurangzeb in 1687, after which it declined in importance. Today, it is a popular tourist site and a symbol of Hyderabads rich heritage.

name: Chhanda Barman
review_text:
Golconda fort was originally a mud fort built by the Kakatiya rulers in the eleventh century. Quality Qutub shah fortified it in the sixteenth century. There are two ways to the fort. One way with many stairs, another has less stairs as some elevation is achieved with ramps which are on the right. If you are travelling with senior citizens, you can take the path on the right and descend by the main way. My mom has knee issues and she almost made it the whole way. The palace has only the queens quarters left which is at the bottom of the hill. The top has the darbal hall and a beautiful view of Hyderabad, a jail cell, a mosque and a temple. Would recommend buying tickets online if you are visiting on holidays because it does get crowded.
Visited on
Weekday

name: PRAVEEN
review_text:
Ticket counter is open from 5:30 PM
Note : Golconda Fort Timings: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM
Golconda still boasts of mounted cannons, four drawbridges, eight gateways, and majestic halls, magazines, stables

It was originally known as Mankal, and built on a hilltop in the year 1143. It was originally a mud fort under the reign of Rajah of Warangal. Later it was fortified between 14th and 17th centuries by the Bahmani Sultans and then the ruling Qutub Shahi dynasty. Golconda was the principal capital of the Qutub Shahi kings. The inner fort contains ruins of palaces, mosques and a hill top pavilion, which rises about 130 meters high and gives a bird's eye view of other buildings.

name: Najeeb Shareef
review_text:
Visited Golconda Fort's palace complex on a week day,the palace renowned for its exquisite architecture, features grand halls, ornate arches, and stunning courtyards. The palaces ingenious water management system(hot and cold) is exclusively mapped towards Ranis bedroom, including a network of cisterns and channels, showcases the advanced engineering of its time. The forts secret passages and acoustic marvels, like the signaling system used for communication. A tour guide can provide fascinating details about these features, enriching your visit with deeper understanding of the forts strategic and cultural significance.

name: Reddy
review_text:
Golconda Fort is one of Hyderabads most renowned tourist attractions, offering a captivating glimpse into the citys rich history. This impressive historical site is located on the western outskirts of Hyderabad and is a must-visit for anyone who appreciates adventure and exploration. To fully experience the fort, you should set aside at least two to three hours, as there is much to see and discover.

Climbing to the top of Golconda Fort is a rewarding experience, but it can be physically demanding. We made our way up the stairs to reach the summit, where we were treated to breathtaking views of the surrounding area. If you prefer an easier ascent, consider using the relatively flat staircase located on the right side of the fort, as it offers a less steep climb. Its also important to carry water with you, as the climb can be exhausting, especially in warmer weather.

Once at the top, youll find yourself surrounded by stunning panoramic views and a sense of serenity that allows you to fully appreciate the forts archaeological significance. The architecture and design of Golconda Fort are truly remarkable, with intricate details that showcase the engineering marvels of the past. One feature that stands out is the forts ingenious water supply system, which is sure to leave you amazed.

For those interested in learning more about the forts history and significance, hiring a guide is highly recommended. They can provide fascinating insights and stories that bring the forts history to life. Additionally, if you visit in the evening, you can enjoy the spectacular light and sound show, which narrates the forts history and highlights its architectural grandeur in a dramatic and engaging manner.

Overall, Golconda Fort offers a perfect blend of adventure, history, and breathtaking views, making it an unmissable destination in Hyderabad.

Weekday

name: Prantik Maitra
review_text: Golkonda Fort, located near Hyderabad, is a remarkable historical site that showcases the architectural brilliance and rich history of the Qutb Shahi dynasty. The fort is famous for its acoustics, where a clap at the entrance can be heard at the top, and its massive walls, intricate gateways, and hidden passages. Climbing to the top rewards visitors with stunning views of the city. The evening sound and light show adds a magical touch, narrating the forts storied past. Despite some areas needing better maintenance, Golkonda Fort remains a must-visit for history enthusiasts and tourists alike.

name: Yk Ansari
review_text:
Golconda Fort, located in Hyderabad, India, is a majestic structure that stands as a testament to the engineering prowess and historical grandeur of the Qutub Shahi dynasty. Originally built as a mud fort by the Kakatiya dynasty in the 12th century, it was later expanded and fortified by the Qutub Shahi rulers in the 16th century, transforming it into a formidable citadel.

The fort is renowned for its ingenious architecture, which includes robust walls, massive gates, and intricate water supply systems that demonstrate the advanced engineering skills of its time. One of the most fascinating aspects of Golconda Fort is its acoustic system, where a clap at the forts entrance can be heard clearly at the highest point, the Bala Hissar pavilion, located a kilometer away. This feature was used as a warning system to alert the inhabitants in case of an attack.

The fort also boasts of grand palaces, royal halls, and several temples and mosques, reflecting the cultural amalgamation that took place during the Qutub Shahi era. The panoramic view of Hyderabad from the top of the fort is breathtaking, offering a glimpse into the sprawling city below.

Golconda Fort is not only a significant historical site but also a cultural hub, with its evening sound and light show bringing to life the history and legends associated with the fort. Well-preserved and accessible, the fort continues to draw visitors from around the world, providing an immersive experience into the rich heritage of the Deccan region.

name: PRASHANT KARAD
review_text:
Golconda Fort, located in Hyderabad, Telangana, is a magnificent historical site that attracts visitors with its rich history and architectural brilliance. Here's a detailed review for Google Maps:

---

**Golconda Fort**

 **Rating: 4.5/5**

**Review:**

Golconda Fort is a must-visit for history enthusiasts and tourists alike. This sprawling fortress, dating back to the 12th century, offers a glimpse into the grandeur of ancient Indian architecture and history.

### Highlights:
1. **Historical Significance:** Originally built by the Kakatiya dynasty and later expanded by the Qutb Shahi kings, the fort has witnessed several important events in Indian history.
2. **Architectural Marvel:** The fort features robust walls, intricate carvings, and impressive gateways. The acoustic system is particularly fascinating, where a clap at the entrance can be heard at the highest point of the fort, almost a kilometer away.
3. **Stunning Views:** Climb to the top to enjoy panoramic views of Hyderabad. The vantage points provide excellent photo opportunities.
4. **Sound and Light Show:** The evening sound and light show narrates the forts history vividly and is highly recommended.
5. **Gardens and Palaces:** Explore the well-maintained gardens, mosques, and palaces within the fort complex.

### Tips for Visitors:
- **Wear Comfortable Shoes:** The fort is vast, and exploring it requires a lot of walking and climbing.
- **Stay Hydrated:** Carry water, especially during the hotter months.
- **Visit Early:** To avoid crowds and heat, plan your visit early in the morning or late afternoon.
- **Guided Tours:** Opt for a guided tour to fully appreciate the fort's history and architecture.
- **Photography:** Don't forget your camera; the fort offers many picturesque spots.

### Visitor Feedback:
- **Positive:** Visitors appreciate the well-preserved ruins, the informative sound and light show, and the breathtaking views from the top.
- **Negative:** Some areas might not be wheelchair accessible, and the fort can get crowded during peak hours.

Overall, Golconda Fort offers a fascinating journey into the past and is an excellent destination for both history buffs and casual tourists.

---

Feel free to adjust the rating and content based on your personal experience!
Visited on
Weekday

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
Not sure

name: Hassan Iyaas
review_text:
My visit to Golconda Fort was an incredible experience and one of the highlights of my trip to Hyderabad. The fort is a magnificent example of historical architecture, offering a glimpse into the grandeur of the past. The well-preserved ruins and expansive layout of the fort make it a fascinating place to explore.

One of the standout features of Golconda Fort is its strategic design and engineering marvels, such as the remarkable acoustics that allow sound to travel over long distances. The climb to the top, while a bit strenuous, is well worth the effort. The panoramic view of Hyderabad from the forts highest point is breathtaking and provides an excellent opportunity for photography.

The fort is often bustling with tourists, but this only adds to its lively and energetic atmosphere. Despite the crowds, the fort is spacious enough to find quieter spots to relax and take in the surroundings. The knowledgeable guides available at the fort can greatly enhance your experience, providing rich historical context and interesting anecdotes about the forts past.

Surrounding Golconda Fort, youll find local markets selling a variety of traditional items and souvenirs. These markets reflect the local culture and offer a delightful shopping experience.

Given the number of visitors, its a good idea to wear a mask and carry hand sanitizer to ensure a safe visit. This small precaution helps you and those around you enjoy the site with peace of mind.

In summary, Golconda Fort is a must-visit destination in Hyderabad, blending history, architecture, and stunning views into an unforgettable experience. Whether youre a history buff or simply looking for a unique place to visit, Golconda Fort will not disappoint.

name: Arjun Raju
review_text: I visited Golconda Fort in 2020 and had an amazing experience, the vast size of this monument is mind- blowing. Whilst other reviewers have described it as a crumbling ruin which is not well looked after I didnt find this to be my experience. It was a captivating 4.5 hours and I could easily have stayed longer. The fort has been renovated in part but is mostly the remains of the original building built in the 1500s. There was a photographic exhibition which was informative about the forts use and showed impressions of what the fort may have looked like in the past. What impressed me was the geometric structures, light on the sandstone and spectacular views from the top. I would highly recommend a trip here as an insight into the history of Hyderabad - it is simply beautiful. If your kids are bold there is a wonderful bat cave here too!

name: Akshay Kumar Pal
review_text:
Golconda Fort is a mesmerizing historical marvel that offers a fascinating glimpse into Indias rich past. The forts impressive architecture, with its grand gateways and intricate carvings, is a testament to the craftsmanship of its time. The panoramic views from the top are breathtaking, providing a perfect backdrop for photography enthusiasts. The sound and light show in the evening adds an enchanting touch, bringing the forts history to life. A visit to Golconda Fort is not just an exploration of history, but an unforgettable experience that leaves you in awe of its grandeur and significance. Highly recommended!

name: Aravind pakide
review_text:
Golconda Fort Hyderabad is an outstanding example of brilliant engineering and magical architecture. Located at a distance of 11km from the city, it is the most famous of all Hyderabad sightseeing places. The name of the fort has been derived from the Telugu words Golla and Konda which together means Shepherds Hill. Founded in the approximately 12th Century by the Kakatiya Kings, this massive Golconda Fort with eight gates and 87 bastions was later built by Qutub Shahi Kings.

One of the Hyderabad's most popular and supreme monuments, Golconda Fort allures every visitor with its unparalleled beauty and grandeur. A Hyderabad Tour is incomplete without a visit to this fort.

However, do keep in mind the Golconda Fort timings and entry fee before planning a visit to this regal symbol of history. For instance, Golconda fort timings are from 9 am to 5.30 pm. After that, visitors are not allowed to enter the fort, unless they are going for the light and show in night. Hence, to explore the beauty of this place at leisure, plan you visit early in the day.

With perimeters of around 11 kilometers, the fort has 15 to 18 foot high walls. It has huge gates that have pointed iron spikes on them. This protected the fort from Elephants damaging the fort as well as enemy attacks. The fort presents a mesmerizing architecture which will astonish you at each and every step. Its also recommended to visit other 2 nearest sightseeing places from Golconda fort, which are Qutub Shahi Tombs and Taramati Baradari.

The system of acoustics in the Fort is something which attracts each and every visitor. The sound of clapping at the entrance can be heard at the 'Bala Hissar which is the highest point and almost a kilometre away. This system was apparently used for communication purposes, especially to alert royal in case of any attack.

Click to enlarge image golconda-fort-hyd.jpgClick to enlarge image golconda-fort-hyderabad-india.jpgClick to enlarge image golconda-fort-hyderabad.jpgClick to enlarge image golconda-fort-images-hyderabad.jpgClick to enlarge image golconda-fort-in-hyderabad.jpgClick to enlarge image golconda-fort-of-hyderabad.jpgClick to enlarge image golconda-fort.jpgClick to enlarge image golconda-hyderabad-fort.jpgClick to enlarge image hyderabad-golconda-fort.jpg

Other attractive features of the Fort include water supply system as well as famous Rahban cannon. Ramdas' prison is one of the popular spot inside the fort. According to legend, Ramdas who was a revenue collector in Abdul Hasan Shahs court was imprisoned. During his imprisonment, he carved Hindu deities on the wall of his cell.

It is said that Golconda fort used to be a famous diamond market attracting merchants from all over the world. It was at Golconda that the famous Kohinoor and Hope diamonds along with others such as The Regent Diamond, Darya-e Nur, Nur-Ul-Ain Diamond were stored.

Sound & Light Show Timings and Tickets Cost
Another feature that makes Golconda fort all the more attractive is the light and sound show presenting its history and facts. The sound and light show at Golconda Fort is done in three languages namely English, Hindi and Telugu with a voice over of Bollywood living legend Amitabh Bachchan. The show timings of sound and light show at Golconda Fort are Show Timings (Nov to Feb): 1st Show 6:30pm 2nd Show 7.45pm & Show Timings (Mar to Oct): 1st Show 7:00pm 2nd Show 8.15pm.

To enter the fort you are required to pay a minimal Golconda fort entry fee of Rs.5; it is Rs. 100 foreign tourists. You have to pay extra if you are planning to take your camera inside. For sound and light show, you are required to buy a separate ticket.

It's a great spot to spend quality time with family while delving into the grandeur of historical landmarks.
