name: Saswata Maulik
review_text: Looks very imposing as well as daunting and has history written in every corner of it. Climbing to the top gave a nice panoramic view of the city of Hyderabad. People with leg problems will be well advised not to attempt climbing to the top of the fort. It really puts lot of pressure on the knee joints for sure. The fort infrastructure has been kept quite well and the various pathways built are of very good help to the visitors in walking and visiting the fort complex. The light and sound show is good. However it needs to give more information on the history of Golconda Fort and the various dynastys which ruled there A must visit site for all travelers.

name: suneel sriharikota
review_text:
Golconda Fort If you want to see this Koti completely once, it will take a whole day because there are so many gates, from where to where, each one is used for what purpose. They are afraid of any enemy coming past the wall because the hill itself is surrounded by a wall. They are at the entrance to see. For sure, if you look at this Golconda fort for a whole day, but if you want to go and look at it permanently, then it is a waste and it is clear for a whole day. One by one, you can see every one of them, how and why they should use it. Its a very very good place if you definitely go there. Its a one day weekend plan when you have time If you do, it will be very good, otherwise you have to go up and down the hill. People with knee pain should not prefer it. Those who dont should definitely try it once. You will know for sure.
Visited on
Weekend

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
No

name: ramanathan krishnappan
review_text:
Golconda fort is definitely worth visiting. Hired a guide for Rs1000/- for an one hour tour of the fort. He explained a lot of things which we might otherwise not know. But the management could keep boards with information about the fort because not everyone would hire a guide. There are two hindu temples in the fort which attract pilgrims in July/August months. I visited in the morning when it was really hot . Maybe evening would have been a better option.

name: Jagannath Jawal
review_text:
Golconda Fort in Hyderabad receives high praise from visitors for its impressive architecture and historical significance. Many reviews highlight the forts stunning views, intricate design, and the fascinating history behind it. Visitors often mention the enjoyable experience of exploring the forts various sections, including the sound and light show that brings its history to life. The fort is also appreciated for being a great spot for photography and for its serene atmosphere. Overall, its considered a must-visit destination for anyone traveling to Hyderabad.

name: Saurabh Verma
review_text:
Amenities at this place are disgusting. It doesnt have a cloak room like other ASI protected sites and i found washrooms missing from the place. Fort is good but it has maintenance issues. You can find bottles and other things inside the fort.

If you are going, dont worry about luggage as nearby shops offer cloak rooms at 20 per bag. Even though i kept my bags at one of the pan shops in front of the fort but I was concerned about safety of my items.

Fort remains open of weekend as well. Dont know why Google Maps shows that the fort is closed on weekends.

Weekend

No

name: SRIRAM
review_text:
Golkonda Fort in Hyderabad is a mesmerizing testament to the citys rich history and architectural prowess. Situated on a granite hill, it boasts impressive ramparts and majestic gateways that once guarded the seat of power of the Qutb Shahi dynasty. The forts strategic location offers breathtaking views of Hyderabads skyline, particularly at sunset. Inside, visitors can explore the intricate palaces, mosques, and ingenious water supply systems that highlight the engineering marvels of its time. Golkonda Forts allure lies not only in its historical significance but also in its ability to evoke a sense of wonder and admiration for Indias cultural heritage.
Visited on
Weekend

name: Rhishav Sikdar
review_text:
The sheer grandeur and magnificence of the fort is breathtaking.

One can hike up to the top of the fort, and it takes about an hour, depending on ones speed. Breathtaking views of the city and remains of the grandeur that once existed.

The Sound&Light show in the evening is a MUST watch to get a good idea about the history of the fort. The show has been beautifully curated with a laser show and with Amitabh Bachan voice over, which adds the real charm to it.

A fabulous walk down history and highly recommend for all visiting Hyderabad.

name: Anindya Sil
review_text:
Golconda fort is one of best tourist attractions of Hyderabad. This amazing historical place is situated in the western outskirts of Hyderabad.
If you love adventure then this is the perfect place for you to visit. It will take a minimum of two to three hours to visit this place completely.
We climbed up the stairs to reach top of the fort. It is suggested to avoid steep staircase to climb up. There is one comparatively flat staircase at the right side of the fort. Dont forget to carry water while climbing as it could be very tiring. One could enjoy the breath-taking views from the top. Spend some serene time to enjoy archaeological excellence of this place. You would definitely get amazed to their water supply system.
One could take guide to know more about this place. Also one can enjoy light and show in the evening.
Visited on
Weekday

Wait time
Up to 10 min

name: Shoban Pawar
review_text:
Golconda Fort in Hyderabad, India, is a remarkable historic site. Originally built in the 13th century by the Kakatiya dynasty and later expanded by the Qutb Shahi kings, it showcases incredible medieval architecture.

Visitors enter through massive gates with iron spikes meant to stop elephant attacks. Inside, there are royal palaces, halls, temples, mosques, and living quarters. One fascinating feature is the fort's acoustics: a clap at the entrance can be heard at the top, a kilometer away.

The Sound and Light Show is a highlight, telling the fort's history with lights and narrations. It explains how Golconda became a major diamond trading hub and its strategic importance over the centuries.

From the highest point of the fort, visitors get stunning views of Hyderabad. While the climb is steep, the view is worth it.

Some parts of the fort are not well-maintained and could use better preservation. More information and guided tours would also help visitors appreciate its history more.

Overall, Golconda Fort is a must-see for anyone interested in history and architecture. Its impressive buildings, unique acoustics, and great views make it a memorable visit.
Visited on
Weekday

Also I managed to climb up to the top and the view of the entire city was mesmerizing. Such structures tell us how advanced ancient technology was so advanced at that time. Though the interior is almost in ruins, the structure tells a lot about the legacy and aura of emperors.

name: BULLET AALA JAAT
review_text:
The fort is very big and very knowledgeable for dakshina Madhya bharata itihaasa. The fort was built by the Hindu kakatiyas Raja. The fort was built mainly for diamonds bussiness and storage of diamonds like kohinoor ,dariya -e- noor, regent, blue hope, .Later in 1687 the Mughal emperor Aurangzeb ruined the fort after he won the fight over 8 months of battle with Rajas .
The fort has 6 main entrance to enter the Golconda fort. 1. Bala hisar darwaja. 2 fathe darwaja. 3. Moti darwaja. 4. Banjara darwaja. 5. Makka darwaja. 5. Entrance darwaja.
The attraction in fort is . Abyssian arches, dhwani prangan, Ashlah Khana, Taramati mosque, Ramadas Bandikhana, Camel stable, private chambers (kilwat), Mortuary bath, Nagina bagh, Ramasasas kotha, Durbar hall, Ambar khana etc. The entry ticket to the fort is 25 INR for indian people and age below 15 years children the entry ticket is free.
The main attraction in the fort is communication system from dhwani prangan to last point of the fort which almost 500 meters away from dhwani prangan. You must try it with guide . Otherwise youll not understand the communication system.. which is built by kakatiyas Raja.......
ASI (archeological survey of India) not doing to much to maintain the fort. centre government should look in to this. otherwise ASI will spoil the fort . I also want to tell ASI to please maintain this fort properly because all walls of the fort damaging slowly you should take care about this otherwise slowly people will stop to visit the fort. The ticket counter of the fort is now bigger than it was before...

name: Aditendra Bhardwaj
review_text:
Golconda Fort, a historic marvel near Hyderabad, offers a captivating glimpse into Indias rich past. Its imposing architecture and strategic design showcase the prowess of ancient engineering. The forts intricate acoustic system, designed to carry whispers across vast distances, remains a fascinating highlight. However, maintenance issues detract from the visitor experience; some areas are poorly preserved, affecting authenticity. The lack of informative signage diminishes understanding of its historical significance, leaving visitors wanting more context. Despite these drawbacks, Golconda Forts sheer grandeur and panoramic views of Hyderabad make it a worthwhile visit for history enthusiasts and tourists alike.

name: Suresh Menon
review_text:
Ive been there several times, but the last I went was in 2017.
Its a nice place to spend about a half a day and one can take in the Qutub Shahi Tombs & the Taramati Baradari, both nearby for intrepid walkers, or close enough for auto-rickshaw drivers to fleece you..
Golconda Fort has been maintained very well,, though its now more than 500 years since its inception.
However there are a lot of encroachments and breaches along its imperious perimeter walls.
Nevertheless, a gem of the twin cities and well worth multiple visits.
There is a sound and light show, & if one is lucky, one can even witness a movie or a serial shoot in progress.
2/7/24: Not much changes over the last seven years. There are several security personnel nowadays, who keep following you everywhere, and I dont know whether its a good or bad thin!

name: Syed Faizan Danish
review_text:
1. Absolutely stunning! Golconda Fort offers incredible views and rich history. A must-visit in Hyderabad.

2. Fascinating fort with well-preserved structures. The climb is worth it for the panoramic views.

3. A historical gem. The sound and light show in the evening is a great way to learn about its past.

4. Impressive architecture and beautiful surroundings. Wear comfortable shoes for the hike.

5. Golconda Fort is a blend of history and adventure. The acoustics in the fort are amazing!

6. It is open on weekends.

7. At least 3 hours are required to visit the entire fort.

8. Come early to fully explore and enjoy your visit.

9. The fort is well-maintained, and the guides are knowledgeable and friendly.

10. The best time to visit is during the cooler months to avoid the heat.

11. There are plenty of spots to take stunning photographs.

12. Carry water and some snacks, as the fort area can be quite extensive.

13. The forts history dates back to the 13th century, making it a significant historical site.

14. You can enjoy a panoramic view of Hyderabad from the top of the fort.

15. There are many interesting legends and stories associated with the fort, adding to its charm.

name: Abdullah Noor
review_text:
It was an amazing experience visiting this place. The best attraction in entire Hyderabad, probably because of the guide who gave a deep dive into the history of the place. Highly recommended for people who like historical landmarks or even if you dont.

name: Amit Naik
review_text:
Historical Significance: Golconda Fort stands as a testament to Indias rich medieval history, having been a significant center of power and trade, especially known for its diamonds.

Architectural Marvel: The forts architecture is remarkable, featuring robust walls, intricate designs, and innovative acoustics that demonstrate advanced engineering techniques of the time. The strategic layout and the majestic gateways leave visitors in awe.

Visitor Experience: Visitors often praise the panoramic views of Hyderabad from the fort's highest points. The light and sound show is a highlight, offering an engaging recount of the forts history. The forts expansive area requires a good amount of walking, so comfortable footwear is recommended.

Preservation: While well-maintained by the Archaeological Survey of India, some parts of the fort show signs of wear and neglect. Efforts are ongoing to preserve its structure and heritage.

Accessibility: Located in Hyderabad, the fort is easily accessible by various means of transportation. However, navigating the fort's steep paths and stairs can be challenging for some visitors.

Overall: Golconda Fort is a must-visit for history enthusiasts and architecture lovers. It offers a deep dive into Indias past, coupled with a memorable experience of exploring a historic marvel.

name: Muhsin CA
review_text:
Golconda Fort, located in Hyderabad, Telangana, is a majestic and historic fort that stands as a testament to Indias rich cultural and architectural heritage. Originally constructed in the 13th century by the Kakatiya dynasty, the fort was later expanded by the Qutb Shahi dynasty and became a thriving center of culture, politics, and trade.

One of the most striking features of Golconda Fort is its impressive architecture. The fort is an excellent example of medieval engineering, with massive stone walls, intricate carvings, and grand gateways. The fort is built on a granite hill, and its elevated position provides a panoramic view of the surrounding landscape. The engineering marvels of the fort, such as its advanced water supply system and acoustics, are a testament to the ingenuity of its builders. One of the most fascinating aspects is the forts acoustic system, where a hand clap at the entrance dome can be heard clearly at the Bala Hisar pavilion, the highest point almost a kilometer away.

As you explore the fort, youll come across several notable structures, including the Fateh Darwaza (Victory Gate), which features spikes to prevent elephants from charging the gates. The Taramati Mosque, with its beautiful arches and minarets, and the royal palaces, offer a glimpse into the opulence of the Qutb Shahi rulers. The fort also houses the remains of a mosque, various halls, and living quarters, which provide a window into the life and times of its inhabitants.

Golconda Fort is also known for its role in the diamond trade. It is believed to be the birthplace of some of the worlds most famous diamonds, including the Koh-i-Noor and the Hope Diamond. The forts strategic location and its control over the diamond mines in the region made it an important center of trade and wealth.

Visitors to Golconda Fort can enjoy a light and sound show in the evening, which narrates the history of the fort and the dynasties that ruled it. The show, set against the backdrop of the illuminated fort, is a mesmerizing experience that brings the forts history to life.

Despite its historical significance and architectural grandeur, Golconda Fort does have some areas that could be better maintained. The pathways and some of the structures show signs of wear and tear, and improved upkeep could enhance the visitor experience. Additionally, better signage and informational displays would help visitors understand the historical context of the various structures within the fort.

In conclusion, Golconda Fort is a must-visit destination for history enthusiasts, architecture buffs, and anyone interested in Indias rich cultural heritage. Its magnificent architecture, historical significance, and the enchanting light and sound show make it a memorable and enriching experience. While there are areas that could benefit from better maintenance, the forts grandeur and historical importance make it a landmark worth exploring.

Weekday

name: Vivek Tamilmani
review_text:
Loved visiting this historic location. The fort features technological marvels way ahead of its time.

It is recommended that one reached the fort by 4PM and hire a guide. You can walk the entire stretch of the fort by 6:30PM. Recommended to travel light and water points are available at various location on the fort. I carried water bottles.

There is a temple atop the fort.

Washrooms are available close to the garden and adjacent to the light and sound show seating area.

Later you can buy tickets for the Light and sound show that starts at 7PM (English show ). I am attaching the photo of the timings and fare.

I request the administration to put up more sign boards showing directions and a brief on the various buildings within the fort complex

name: Mohsin Khan
review_text:
Guard Behaviour is so rude, they have no manners how to talk with family.
Half of my family entered at 5:30PM and due to some reason half of my family were not allowed to enter at 5:31PM.
I know there are rules but, if half of family entered at time, its so rude they didnt allow us.
In our north India we understand the situation, and respect everyones emotions.
These south people think they are superior, 90% of tourism is in North India, and they behave like they are all above.
Very Disappoint with behaviour of Hyderabad people.

review_text:
One needs to be prepared before you step in as it requires a lot of climbing, I would suggest going here during the evening or when the weather is nice. Please make sure to not throw the garbage here and there and keep it clean. If you are lucky enough yoj might find some movie shooting happening there like we did :)

name: Gagan Jain
review_text:
First visit to this historic site. Morning or Evening visit is recommended as during a sunny day its going to be exhausting and it wont be fun at all.
Place Can be enjoyed in groups, family or friends.

Observed Lack of awareness in people visiting the fort as there are plenty of garbage especially plastics lying here and there till the point we reach on the top of the fort.
Use of Plastic must be prohibited inside the premises. People can bring there own water bottles and there are many water filters available to refill.

Toilets were clean and the gardens were quiet maintained.

The view of city from the top is something one should experience on his/her own.

name: brendotvr6
review_text:
At the front gate I was immediately approached by a tour guide. His English was pretty good. I paid 300 rupees to get in and off we went. He took me through the lower half of the fort, telling me about the history the whole way, what each building was used for. His fee was 1500 rupees, about $20. From there, I climbed to the top palace on my own. It is quite the climb, be sure to bring water! The views of the fort from the top and the modern city beyond were incredible with clear skies. The tour was about 45 minutes. I spent a total of two and a half hours there. This is a very large fort with many rooms and buildings to explore.

name: Pamela Aw Yong
review_text:
Please bring cash! Otherwise there is no way of buying a ticket with a credit card. Some reviews mentioned that you can purchase tickets online but we werent able to find a reliable site. Locals were nice enough to ask if wed like to Google Pay them and have them pay in cash for us. We turned them down as we werent sure if Google Pay transactions across countries would work. We left without entering.

There were guides at the entrance which might/might not accept online/credit card payment but we didnt really asked. The guides will show you a guide card (some license(?)) to ask you to go with them. My local trusted cab driver says its a great place to visit so Im definitely coming again on my next visit!

---------------------------------------

Editing as I came to returned in Jun 2024. This time, they accepted payment online! There are QR codes leading to 2 online payment platforms. We tried 1 but international credit card gave us issues, so we went back to cash. Cash is slightly more expensive than online payment but negligible.

We arrived at 845am on Thurs. gMaps says it opens at 830am. We were informed by the guards that it opens at 9am.

While waiting outside, a local registered guide approached us and tried to give us information (that the guards already gave), ushered us towards the ticketing counter. We expressed that we didnt have sufficient cash and wanted to pay online, he watched us fumble and reluctantly go back to paying by cash.

He didnt talk about guide-fees at any point but I was suspecting as ive met other guides in my previous visit who were transparent with prices. Somehow, by following us, he became our self-appointed guide and started bringing us through the area. We werent sure if he was just being nice to guide us to the entrance but as it went on, it became clear to me. (Definitely not obvious to an unsuspecting tourist!!!)

So we stopped to ask after passing the area where people clap to hear the echo (not far from entrance) & only then, did he finally explain his charges.

Cant remember how much he quoted but he had 2hr vs 1hr options & his prices were changing as the conversation went along. He definitely quoted more than the 750inr which other reviews here mentioned.

Our concern was that we genuinely didnt have enough cash between the two of us (again cash is BIG here, we were better prepared but not THAT prepared) so we couldnt go ahead with a full guided tour. He probably thought we were lying about not having enough cash 

We had 500inr and told him that he can stop after 500inr worth of guiding. He didnt seem to get it and kept asking for more - gave us a really sad face which broke my heart even though i genuinely felt uncomfortable with the lack of price transparency and disclosure.

At the end, my buddy firmly said to take it or leave it. And he left without taking the 500inr. NGL, i felt very sad. The language barrier also made it hard as I wasnt sure if he fully understood why we didnt want to proceed :( Im all for supporting locals and their hard work but the approach he had with us made us uncomfortable and it was hard communicating. I hope he found more suitable groups to guide after us.

When we left, we saw him at the entrance. He still seemed jolly and nice but we were done with him at that point.
---------------------------------------

Heres my walk through experience without a guide:

(1) There was reconstruction going on for some of the fallen ruins.

(2) There were signs in english and hindi explaining what each big structure was - but insufficient as they were sparse and brief.

(3) Take a picture of the map carved onto the rock (or download one online before going in) - you might need it to navigate

(4) Views from up there (200steps approx) are CRAZY, we could see the whole city

(5) Very peaceful & quiet. Some places vandalized by visitors & other places stank of pigeons/poo.

Would come again with enough cash to hire a guide (id imagine the history/stories would be cool) although this was less impressive than the red fort in delhi.

Weekday

review_text:
11th century ruin in extensive grounds. 300 rupees for a foreigner to enter and you can engage a guide for 1,500 for a 2 hour tour.

We were short on cash so wandered around by ourselves, finding the path to the top. Its a decent walk to the top with 200 steps up. Unfortunately littered with the discarded plastic bottles of the night crowd, its both derelict and majestic depending on the view.

Worth a visit if youre in Hyderabad.

name: Chandan Prakash Jha
review_text:
Golconda Fort, nestled in the western outskirts of Hyderabad, Telangana, is a monumental testament to the rich tapestry of Indian history. This imposing citadel, originally known as Mankal, dates back to 1143 when it was constructed as a mud fort by the Rajah of Warangal. Over the centuries, it has undergone significant transformations under the reigns of various dynasties, evolving into the architectural marvel we witness today.

At the summit of the fort, visitors are treated to panoramic views of Hyderabad and can explore the Jagadamba and Mahankali temples. The Jagadamba temple, a revered shrine dating back to the early Kakatiya period, attracts thousands of devotees, especially during the vibrant Bonalu festival. Legend has it that shepherds discovered this ancient temple, lending the fort its name, Golconda, derived from Gwala Konda or the hill of the shepherds.

Golconda Fort is not just a monument but a chronicle of centuries. Its towering walls, majestic ruins, and sacred temples narrate stories of its glorious past. A visit to Golconda is a journey through time, an opportunity to immerse oneself in the legacy of Indias rich and diverse history. Whether youre drawn to its historical significance, architectural grandeur, or cultural depth, Golconda Fort promises an enriching experience that will linger in your memory long after youve left its ancient gates.

One of the must place to visit in Hyderabad. This is a historical place that is well maintained. When we visited, we had a chance to view the laser show, and it was a great experience. It showcases the history that is well presented and easy to learn. The show was at 7 pm and there is enough seats to watch the show.

name: Dhanesh Kabra
review_text:
Definitely a must see place when visiting Hyderabad. Undoubtedly one of the most magnificent fort complexes in India. Must hire a guide to understand the Fort in and out otherwise will seem like wandering in the ruins. The MahaKali temple atop the fort has a mesmerizing feel. Birds eye view of the city of Hyderabad gives one an idea of how powerful the fort and its rulers were in their times. Missed the light and sound show.

Weekday

name: Karthik Subramanya Karvaje
review_text:
Nice fort, could have been maintained better.
Being a fort, it has many steep stairs. Lots of climbing required for elders to reach the top. However, lots can be seen even at the lower levels of the fort with minimal climbing. Lower levels have wheelchair friendly ramps in many places (the wooden ramps are rickety at some places)
Very good light show along with history of Golconda fort explained using light projection.
140/head for the light show.
25/head for adult fort entry (can be bought online/onsite)
30 Car parking just outside the gate.
Visited on
Weekend

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
Yes

name: Sanket Hinge
review_text:
Hailing from the Maharashtra and have seen huge forts built by great warrior Shri Shivaji Maharaj, we have different perception when they say a Fort.
Golkonda fort is a beautiful mixture of fort and Palace. The arches, small buildings inside made with stone work are noticeable and decorative.
The entire fort is well maintained and secured. The garden areas are clean and pleasant. Security guards are available to maintain decency and control crowd.
Fort is not tough to climb. Stairs are moderately short.
Once you are up, one can witness a well developed Hyderabad tech-towers skyline with lush greenery.
The water tank is available just below the top. Also, a small shop selling cold drinks, water is available at the top.
If you are looking for good pictures, then it is recommended to visit in the morning when less crowd can be experienced.
Entry fee - 25 INR.
Guides available if required more information.
Parking is available at some distance from the entrance. Same place where buses are also available.
Visited on
Weekend

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
No

name: Manwithoutname
review_text:
A must place to visit if you are in Hyderabad.
You ll need roughly 2 hours to visit the entire place. Ticket price is 25 and they dont accept UPI so dont forget to carry cash. You can also buy water and beverages on the top hill of the fort too, so dont need to carry everything right upto the top.

Most important info:
1. The ticket counter closes at 5:30 pm and the entry gate closes at 6:00pm.

2. Its closed on Fridays.

name: Tehzeeb Khan
review_text:
Golconda Fort is a timeless marvel that exudes historical grandeur and architectural brilliance. Yesterday, I had the pleasure of exploring its majestic corridors and towering ramparts with my beloved, Huma. The ambiance was enchanting, and every stone seemed to whisper tales of bygone eras. We spent a delightful time immersing ourselves in the rich history and soaking in the breathtaking views from the top. It was truly an unforgettable experience, made even more special in the company of my love.
Visited on
Weekday

name: WildTyres
review_text:
1. Absolutely stunning! Golconda Fort offers incredible views and rich history. A must-visit in Hyderabad.

2. Fascinating fort with well-preserved structures. The climb is worth it for the panoramic views.

3. A historical gem. The sound and light show in the evening is a great way to learn about its past.

4. Impressive architecture and beautiful surroundings. Wear comfortable shoes for the hike.

5. Golconda Fort is a blend of history and adventure. The acoustics in the fort are amazing!

6 open on the weekends.

7 its required at least 3 hours to visit the full fort.

8 come early and visit

Tour guides are nice and knowledgeable.

name: Prakash Narayanan
review_text:
Golkonda fort is a must visit in your Hyderabad trip or if you stay there. Better to take a guide who can explain various nuances of the fort and also include stories of the kings at that time. I had been to earlier sound and light show and now recently launched (2024) laser show. Both were amazing but the recent one is bit better than the earlier one.

Visiting in a weekday is better to avoid crowds.

name: Vijay Reddy Venumuddala
review_text:
Golconda Fort, located in Hyderabad, is a magnificent fortress with a rich history dating back to the 12th century. Originally built by the Kakatiya dynasty, it was later expanded by the Qutb Shahi kings into the impressive structure it is today. The fort is renowned for its innovative architecture, including advanced water supply systems and acoustics that allowed for communication over long distances.
Perched atop a granite hill, Golconda Fort offers breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape. Its strategic location made it a vital center for trade and administration in medieval times, particularly in the flourishing diamond trade.
Visitors can explore the sprawling complex, which includes grand gateways, royal apartments, mosques, temples, and barracks. The highlight of the fort is the majestic Durbar Hall, where the Qutb Shahi rulers held court and conducted official ceremonies.
The fort is also famous for its sound and light show, which narrates the history of Golconda in an engaging manner, bringing the past to life for visitors.
Overall, Golconda Fort stands as a testament to Hyderabads rich heritage and architectural prowess, attracting tourists and history enthusiasts from around the world.
Visited on
Weekend

name: Hummings by Humera
review_text:
It is an ancient Fort and a must visit on the trip to Hyderabad. The Fort has been renovated at some places but a lot of renovated still needs to be done.
A visitor must wear good walking shoes as there are lots of steps and they can be slippery in rains. A good walk of around 3 kms can be expected while visiting the Fort.
There is a small kiosk for snacks and drinks inside the Fort.
I would recommend taking a local guide for the tour of the Fort. General price of the guide is Rs. 750.

Weekday

No wait

name: Dipankar Saha
review_text:
The historic fort holds significant importance to the city of Hyderabad. It is a substantial structure, and visitors must ascend a series of stairs to reach the hilltop fort, which offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city and a captivating sunset. This site is a must-see destination within the city. Please note that the road leading to the fort is somewhat narrow due to its location in the old part of Hyderabad. The last entry time to the fort is 5:30 PM. If you arrive after this time, you can purchase a ticket online and present it at the gate for entry. The light show is often hyped and may not be particularly enjoyable. The entry ticket price is 20 rupees, while the light show ticket costs 80 rupees.
Visited on
Weekend

No wait

Reservation recommended

review_text:
The Golconda Fort is a historic fortress located in Hyderabad, India. Its renowned for its impressive architecture and history, dating back to the 16th century when it was constructed by the Kakatiya dynasty. Its a popular tourist attraction and a UNESCO World Heritage Site, offering stunning views of the surrounding area.

name: Kunal A
review_text:
Heritage place with a decent hiking option. An historical place with lots of story inside. Take a guide if you want to enjoy the real history of this fort. Jagadamba temple on the top of the fort is an added advantage. Your effort will be paid when you reach the top point of the fort (Deewane Aam or Deewane Khas) Very beautiful view of Hyderabad City from its top..almost everything can be seen.

Echo of Portico Clapping will surprise you.

Pls have drinking water with you to avoid the summer thirst.

Entry fees: 25 Rs. Per head

Free for kids.

name: Saurabh Kapoor
review_text:
Its a good place for history lovers and people with a touch of emotion for the heritage of the country.

Its an old and preserved solo fort of Hyderabad, the stone is strong and attractive although the overall condition of the major portion of the fort is not good.

There is a Devi temple along with a cave type structure dedicated to Sri Rama, at the top of the hill is the main hall of the fort. One can enjoy the panoramic view of the city from there.

name: Sura Dileep
review_text:
Good Place to Visit in Hyderabad.

Golconda Fort is located in the western part of Hyderabad city at a distance of 9 km from Hussain Sagar Lake. The outer fort covers an area of   three square kilometers and is 4.8 kilometers long.
It is best to visit here in the evening. The fort is allowed to be visited only till 05:30 pm.
Ticket rates
Indian Citizens Adults Rs.25,
Foreigners 200 rupees.

Public holiday

name: Patricia
review_text:
The Golconda Fort is an unmissable experience while in Hyderabad. Its a massive fortified structure which though now may lie in ruins, was at its time of construction a magnificent protector of a large sultanate. Orginally belonging to the Kakatoyas, the fort rose to prominence under the Bahamani Sultans who made it their capital. The large structure was surrounded by a moat. Visiting the site does involve some light trekking as most of the structures are at the top of the mound. Once at the top, the extensive views of the city are an amazing highlight. Also do not the light and sound show!

name: PRADEEP A
review_text:
The ticket rate for visiting this archeological treasure is a mere Rs.25, so theres no need to worry about breaking the bank. This site can truly be considered a gem among monuments and forts from the Deccan Sultanate era, holding a wealth of historical and cultural significance.

I highly recommend visiting this site either in the morning or evening. In the morning, you can witness the tranquil beauty of the surroundings as they awaken to the day, with gentle sunlight casting a golden hue over the ancient structures. Its a peaceful time to explore and appreciate the intricate details and rich history that this site has to offer.

On the other hand, visiting in the evening offers a different experience altogether. As the sun begins to set, the monument and its surroundings are bathed in a warm, enchanting glow, creating a magical ambiance that is perfect for leisurely strolls and capturing stunning photographs. The evening light also highlights the architectural marvels of the fort, showcasing their grandeur and craftsmanship in a captivating way.

Whichever time you choose to visit, be it the morning or evening, youre sure to be enchanted by the beauty and historical significance of this unique monument and fort from the Deccan Sultanate.
Visited on
Weekend

Up to 10 min

Reservation recommended
No

name: Jishnu Arvind M
review_text:
The architecture of Golconda Fort is awe-inspiring. The complex is spread over a vast area and is surrounded by imposing walls that offer a glimpse into the grandeur of its past. The fort features impressive gateways, massive bastions, and numerous beautifully crafted structures, including the Royal Palace, Durbar Hall, and the Taramati Mosque. The strategic layout of the fort showcases intelligent planning, with various levels, intricate water supply systems, and defensive mechanisms that were ahead of their time

name: Jithin Nair
review_text:
Must visit place while you are in Hyderabad.

The entry ticket is Rs.25 and it requires at least 2 to 3 hours to explore the Fort completely. The best time to visit is either morning or after 4pm.

Golconda Fort is located in the western part of Hyderabad city and is about 9 km from the Hussain Sagar Lake. The outer fort occupies an area of three square kilometers, which is 4.8 kilometers in length.

The history of Golconda Fort goes back to early 13th century, when it was ruled by the Kakatiya's followed by Qutub Shahi kings, who ruled the region in 16th and 17th century. The fortress rests on a granite hill 120 meters high while huge crenellated ramparts surround this structure.

name: Parvathy Nair
review_text:
Located in Hyderabad, India, Golkonda Fort stands as a testament to the rich history and architectural brilliance of the region. As one of Indias most renowned forts, Golkonda encapsulates centuries of cultural heritage, strategic significance, and artistic ingenuity. Built during the 13th century by the Kakatiya dynasty, Golkonda Fort underwent several expansions and renovations under the Qutb Shahi dynasty, transforming it into the formidable structure we see today. The fort served as a pivotal stronghold for various ruling dynasties, including the Bahmani Sultanate and the Mughal Empire, due to its strategic location and impregnable defenses.
Golkonda Forts architectural brilliance lies in its ingenious design and meticulous construction. The forts imposing walls, bastions, and ramparts showcase the advanced military architecture of its time. Visitors can marvel at the intricate water supply system, secret passages, and acoustically designed palaces, reflecting the sophistication of medieval engineering and urban planning. Golkonda Fort stands as an enduring symbol of Hyderabads illustrious past and architectural splendor. Whether youre a history enthusiast, architecture aficionado, or a curious traveler, a visit to Golkonda Fort promises an unforgettable journey through centuries of captivating history and unparalleled craftsmanship. It is a must-visit destination that leaves an indelible mark on all who behold its magnificence.

name: ARYAN DURGE
review_text:
Me and friends made up a plan to visit this famous fortress so we went to this place at weekend. You can reach this place using city bus no 66G it reaches direct if not available then go for 505( shankarpally bus ) from medhipatnam upto main rad then book a ride for 2.5km . Ticket price is nominal upto 25rs for adult. Best time to visit is before summer and after rainy season. Me and my friends have explored the whole fort it was nice and memorable. You can see various amazing facts of the fort. And can have good photos  with your bestie we have free drinking water facility In few spots. Visit bhavani Mata mandhir you have a rest spot at the top if you feel tired and see the view of whole golconda

name: BD Tanzim Yousuf
review_text:
GOLCONDA FORT || Golconda Fort || HYDERABAD || INDIA

Golconda Fort, the most beautiful in India, is located some distance from Hyderabad city. The fort was built during the Qutb Shahi reign. Perched atop a 120m high hill, the fort is surrounded by fortified walls with cannonades and fortified gates with iron wedges to prevent elephant attacks from attacking troops. The sound plan of the fort is very advanced as someone clapping at the entrance can be heard from the top of the hill. All these fort construction plans show amazing engineering skills. Right next to the outer walls of the fort are the royal tombs of the Qutb Shahi rulers in a beautiful garden.

How to go: You can fly directly to Hyderabad from Bangladesh. And from Bangladesh by bus/train to Kolkata and from Kolkata to Hyderabad by train.

Where to stay: Secundrabad or Nampally in Hyderabad will get you rooms starting from Rs 500.

To a traveler the whole world is a village! And it is our responsibility to protect the beauty of this village. Please do not pollute the environment with water bottles, biscuits, cake packets and other garbage. Remember;

Leave nothing but footprints on your journey.

name: Nezin
review_text:
Golconda Fort, situated in Hyderabad, India, is a majestic citadel steeped in history and architectural brilliance. Originally built during the Kakatiya dynasty in the 13th century, Golconda Fort underwent significant expansions and renovations under the Qutb Shahi dynasty, who transformed it into a formidable fortress and a symbol of their power.

Perched atop a granite hill, Golconda Fort boasts impressive defensive structures, including ramparts, bastions, and gates, designed to withstand sieges and attacks. The fortification system is adorned with intricate stonework, including ornate carvings and lattice windows, showcasing the skilled craftsmanship of its builders.

Golconda Fort is also renowned for its innovative acoustic design, particularly the famed clapping hands phenomenon, where sound echoes can be heard at the highest point of the fort even from the entrance, facilitating communication across long distances.

Throughout its history, Golconda Fort served as a center of governance, trade, and culture, attracting merchants, artisans, and scholars from far and wide. Today, it stands as a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a popular tourist destination, offering visitors a glimpse into Hyderabads illustrious past and the architectural marvels of medieval India.

Public holiday

name: Amaranath Reddy
review_text:
Golconda Fort in Hyderabad is praised by visitors for its historical significance and impressive architecture. Key highlights include the panoramic views from the top, the forts strategic and intricate design, and the enriching experience provided by guides who share fascinating stories and facts. The climb to the forts summit is steep but rewarding, with recommendations to visit during cooler months. Safety tips such as carrying water and being cautious of pickpockets are advised. The surrounding area offers additional attractions, making a visit here a comprehensive experience. The light and sound show is another popular attraction, offering an engaging way to learn about the forts rich history.

name: Mango Page
review_text:
We had a wonderful time in Golconda Fort. It was a very sunny and bright day so we were relieved that we had with us our hats, sunglasses and a big bottle of water. One has to buy tickets and a guide is recommended. Our guide gave us valuable information and it made a history aficionado like me extremely glad. There are 2 tours, a short tour costing Rs. 750 which takes around an hour. And a long tour costing Rs. 1000 which takes 2 hours or so. The long tour comprises of walking up a hill along a long flight of steps which wouldve been tough under the noon sun so we opted for the short tour. The Palace is covered fully in the short tour. Long tours are better during the evening.

The fort has a shop to buy food, drinks and get your pictures taken. It has been maintained very well, both the grounds and the gardens were clean and no gutka packets or chips packets were strewn around. I do recommend getting a guide because it just enriched our experience even more.

I absolutely loved visiting the golconda fort which once gave us the Kohinoor.
Visited on
Weekend

No wait

Reservation recommended
No

name: Amir Khan
review_text:
Golconda Fort is a mesmerizing historical treasure that stands as a testament to Hyderabads rich heritage. The impressive architecture, with its acoustically advanced structures and majestic ruins, paints a vivid picture of the past. Climbing to the top rewards you with breathtaking views of the city and the surrounding landscape. The light and sound show adds a captivating touch, narrating the forts storied history. Golconda is not just a fort; its a journey through time, making it a must-visit destination for history enthusiasts and anyone seeking a blend of architectural brilliance and tales of bygone eras.

name: Dipayan Haldar
review_text:
It is a historical place in Hyderabad and also it near by Mehdipatanam bus stand and with in few kilometres famous chilkur Balaji temple also known for visa Balaji temple is located. In Telangana you can travel at 120 for men day pass for 24 hours . And for women it is free as of under Telangana government scheme (at present 2024) . You have to walk on steps around 300+ to see the historical objects.
And the shows run after the day completion like after 7:00 pm or 6: 30 pm according to the season screen timing varies. Ticket price also starts from the range of 100 and kids and all are not sure about the pricing . Still the metro is available up to Mehdipatanam bus stop . Still you can enjoy and learn more about it by visiting this most suggested place ..

Weekend

name: surabhi chakraborty
review_text:
Its a superb place to visit during weekends, it is one the historical place in Hyderabad, the whole place is made with stone, and its a huge place, people can easily go and walk inside the fort, and wheelchair accessibility is also there for those who doesnt able to walk, also drinking water is available inside the fort, ticket fee is 25 for adults, and it is open during weekends also, also people can get family photo from the fort as many photographers are there, also inside the fort a temple is there where people can give puja, and there is a laser show which actually describes the historic tale behind this Golconda fort , and this laser show can be watched in 3 languages, English, hindi and Tamil, laser show starts from 7pm , washroom is also available inside the fort, and the staffs are so helpful, cooperative, and I must recommend to visit this place .

Please hire a guide. He will enrich you the tales and if you try to verify later you certainly find it to be true. Will come again for light and sound show in future

name: priyabrata naik
review_text:
This is must visit place when in Hyderabad for sure but plan your trip on weekday if possible as it will be crowded always and parking for four wheeler is very difficult bit times
It have an entry fee not necessarily have to book in advance as it's very fast and almost no waiting
Huge area to cover and if you are planning to go to top of the fort be prepared with right shoes as stairs are very stiff and it's very hot out there without much shade
But the view from top is worth the hike
Rich on ancient India architecture

name: Jagpreet Singh
review_text:
We almost thought of skipping this but decided otherwise at the end. Now I am glad we went!
Make sure you take a guide else its going to be very boring. And when you take a guide, decide in advance if you want half or full tour BEFORE booking him.
We told our guide we will start with half tour and later decide if we want to switch to full tour depending on how tired our 9yr old will be.
At the end of half tour we thought of doing a full tour but the guide started making excuses! (Well he already earned 750rs with half tour and now just for 250rs more, he wasnt enthusiastic to spend another hr). But despite this our guide took our nice pics with slightly creative poses suggestions :)
I think our half tour went for about 90mins.

name: Athisai M.T
review_text:
Golkonda Fort in Hyderabad is a mesmerizing testament to the citys rich history and architectural grandeur. As one approaches the fort, its imposing walls and intricate gateways evoke a sense of awe and wonder. The sprawling complex offers a captivating journey through time, showcasing the opulence and ingenuity of the Qutb Shahi dynasty.

One of the highlights of Golkonda Fort is its impressive acoustics, demonstrated by the famous clapping hands echo effect at the Fateh Darwaza. Visitors can experience the marvel of sound engineering that allowed whispers to be heard from afar, a fascinating feature of the forts design.

The forts strategic location atop a granite hill offers panoramic views of Hyderabad, making it a favorite spot for photographers and history enthusiasts alike. Exploring the various sections of the fort, including the Royal Palace, the Armory, and the Granaries, provides insight into the lifestyle and military prowess of its past inhabitants.

However, while Golkonda Fort is undeniably captivating, it requires significant physical endurance to navigate its steep pathways and numerous steps. Visitors should come prepared with comfortable footwear and ample hydration to fully enjoy the experience.

Overall, a visit to Golkonda Fort is a must for anyone seeking to delve into Hyderabads rich heritage. Its architectural splendor, historical significance, and breathtaking vistas make it a timeless treasure that continues to enchant visitors from around the world.

name: Monodwip Das
review_text:
Golconda Fort is a mesmerizing historical site that beautifully captures the essence of Hyderabads rich past. The impressive architecture and what truly sets it apart is the breathtaking panoramic view it provides. The sprawling landscape, combined with the forts historical charm, creates an unforgettable experience. Exploring the forts intricate corridors and learning about its storied history was both educational and captivating. The maintenance could be improved in certain areas, but overall, its a remarkable experience for history enthusiasts and tourists alike a must-visit destination.

Weekday

name: Govind Rathod
review_text:
Golkonda Fort in Hyderabad is a majestic testament to the citys rich history and architectural prowess. Perched atop a granite hill, this imposing fortress has stood for centuries, bearing witness to the rise and fall of empires and the passage of time.

Dating back to the 13th century, Golkonda Fort served as a bastion of power for various dynasties, including the Kakatiyas, the Bahmanis, and the Qutb Shahis. Its strategic location and formidable defenses made it an impregnable stronghold, earning it a fearsome reputation in medieval India.

Today, Golkonda Fort stands as a fascinating blend of military might and architectural splendor. The massive ramparts, intricate gateways, and sprawling grounds offer a glimpse into the grandeur of its past, while the remnants of palaces, mosques, and royal apartments hint at the opulence that once graced its halls.

A visit to Golkonda Fort is a journey through time, as you wander through its labyrinthine corridors, climb its towering walls, and explore its hidden chambers. The panoramic views from the top of the fort are breathtaking, offering sweeping vistas of Hyderabads skyline and the surrounding landscape.

But beyond its historical significance, Golkonda Fort holds a special place in the hearts of locals and tourists alike as a symbol of Hyderabads heritage and resilience. Its a must-visit destination for anyone seeking to unravel the mysteries of the past and immerse themselves in the grandeur of ancient India.

name: Rachel Jacob
review_text:
Climbing the Golconda Fort requires ample energy, taking nearly two hours for both ascent and descent. Its advisable to start early in the morning to return to the base by noon. Navigating the fort feels like a treasure hunt in a maze, offering breathtaking views along the climb. Purchasing tickets online is recommended for convenience, and while guides are available, their necessity is uncertain given the straightforward layout of the fort.

Public holiday

name: Pravas Mishra
review_text:
Golconda Fort is an absolute gem! Having visited numerous times, I can attest to its timeless charm. The minimal entry fee of just 25/ is a steal for the rich history and breathtaking views it offers. The highlight for me has always been the mesmerizing light show at 6.30 pm, a must-see experience! Every nook and cranny of the fort is steeped in history, making it a photographers paradise. Plus, the availability of washrooms adds to the convenience. Overall, a visit to Golconda Fort is always a memorable journey through time and culture.
Visited on
Weekend

name: Owais
review_text:
Golconda Fort, located in Hyderabad, India, is a historic fortress known for its impressive architecture and strategic location. Originally built in the 12th century, it was later expanded by various dynasties. The fort includes intricate palaces, mosques, and a unique acoustic system that allowed communication across long distances. Today, it stands as a popular tourist attraction, showcasing the rich history of the region.

Weekend

name: Aniket Ankam
review_text:
Golconda Fort is definitely a must-visit place when you are in Hyderabad which is 8 to 10km away from the main city. The entry ticket is 25 and you require at least 2 to 3 hours to explore the Fort completely. To understand the Fort and its history in detail you may hire a guide.
The Fort and area are very well maintained but ruined by the so-called tourists by throw plastics everywhere.
The Fort area is very big and requires hiking to reach the top, be enough hydrated and carry a water bottle along with you. The best time to visit is either morning or post 4 to avoid the sunburns.
I love visiting the Forts as I feel the history in each and every corner of it. Inside the Fort, you will find many photogenic corners.
Overall, it was an amazing adventurous experience visiting the Golconda Fort.
Visited on
Public holiday

Wait time
Up to 10 min

Reservation recommended
Yes

name: Dipayan Aich
review_text:
Must visit place in Hyderabad after Sular Jung Museum. Lots of histroy of almost a 1000 years. How the fort got built to how it changed hands between dynasties is quite interesting. Please avail a guide service to understand different artifacts and their history. Official Govt. guides charge 750/- (depends on group size). But it would be worth. There are two different light and sound show now (as of Jan 2024). You can enjoy one them as well if you visit afternoon/evening time (starts at 6:30pm). Ticket for light and sound show is separate from entry ticket. There is separate 25/- charge for camera.

Weekday

name: Soumyo Mukherji
review_text:
Did not have the energy in the blazing sun to climb to the top. But even the lower tour is also very good. The cost of the guide is a bit steep, but the guide managed to get another family (an army person) to share the cost.

Without a guide, in such forts and places, one tends to overlook the finer and interesting details. So a guide is a must (have done that for all forts and palaces in India and abroad).

Thoroughly enjoyed. A must visit place near Hyderabad. The grounds are beautifully kept and the blooming flowers added an extra color to the reddish stone structures all around.

name: Abhay gahoi
review_text:
I visited the Golconda Fort in Hyderabad with my family and we had a wonderful time exploring the history and culture of this magnificent place. The fort is an impressive example of engineering and architecture, with eight gates, 87 bastions, and a complex system of water supply and acoustics. We learned a lot about the Kakatiya and Qutub Shahi dynasties that ruled over this region and built the fort over the centuries.

The highlight of our visit was the sound and light show that takes place every evening at the fort. The show is a spectacular display of 3D projection, laser lights, and moving heads that narrate the story of the fort and its rulers. The show is available in three languages: English, Hindi, and Telugu. We opted for the English show, which starts at 6:30 pm and lasts for about 30 minutes. The show is very informative and entertaining, and the voice of Bollywood actor Amitabh Bachchan adds to the charm. The show costs 140 rupees for adults and 110 rupees for children in the executive class, and 80 rupees for adults and 60 rupees for children in the normal class.

The Golconda Fort is also famous for its association with the Telugu film industry. The fort has been the backdrop for many movies and songs, including the popular song Magadheera from the movie of the same name, starring Ram Charan and Kajal Aggarwal. The movie was a blockbuster hit and was also dubbed in Hindi, Tamil, and Malayalam. The song was shot at the fort with a large number of dancers and horses, creating a grand visual effect. The fort was also the venue for the inauguration of the movie by Telugu superstar Chiranjeevi, who is the father of Ram Charan.

I would highly recommend visiting the Golconda Fort and its light show to anyone who is interested in history, culture, and entertainment. The fort is a must-see attraction in Hyderabad and a testimony to the rich heritage of Telangana.

And other countries people also come here and visiting here

Weekday

name: Saubhagya Subhadarshi (Julu)
review_text:
Visiting Golconda Fort was a truly enriching experience. The sheer magnitude of history within its walls is awe-inspiring. Exploring the intricate architecture, the whispering galleries, and the panoramic views from the top transported me back in time. The guides were knowledgeable and added depth to the experience. The only downside was the lack of proper maintenance in some areas. Nonetheless, its a must-visit for history buffs and anyone seeking a glimpse into Hyderabads rich past.

name: Piotr Niemialkowski
review_text:
An amazing place full of history.
You must visit them while in Haydrabad.
Unfortunately, the city besieges the fort and even begins to pour into its historic areas.
Minus point for poor guides. Poor information and poor descriptions of places.
Interesting evening light and music shows.
I highly recommend visiting this place - it is worth booking at least 2 hours to see the fortress in peace!
review_translated_text:
Niesamowite miejsce pelne histori.

Koniecznie trzeba je odwiedzic bedac w Haydrabadzie.

Niestety miasto oblega fort a nawet zaczyna wlewac sie w jego historyczne obszary.

Minus dla kiepskich przewodnikow. Slabe informacje i slabe opisy miejsc.

Ciekawe wieczorne pokazy swiatla i muzyki.

Goraco polecam zwiedzic to miejsce warto zarezerwowac min 2 godz na spokojne obejrzenie fortecy!

name: Tapendra Singh
review_text:
Nostalgia, to a time 500 years back. Golconda Fort, a reminder to us of a prestigious past rich in culture,architecture, and the sheer intelligence of those times, spread over 4500 acres. A Fort built by the Iranians, later on conquered by a Hindu king and so forth, it boasts of a Masjid & a Jagadamba ( Devi) temple in the complex of the main Fort, which needs to be reached by 360 steps. The view from the top is amazing ,a scenic Hyderabad can be witnessed.
A very Moorish architecture, keeping in mind the needs of the people of that time. The last conquer, Aurangzeb, made the Nizam of Hyderabad as the caretaker, and unfortunately, the 8th Nizam of Hyderabad passed away recently.
A great time to reminisce our rich heritage with family & friends.
A must-see when visiting Hyderabad.
Visited on
Weekday

Reservation recommended

name: Kalpesh Jain
review_text:
The fort was originally built by Kakatiya ruler Prataparudra in the 11th century.
Its worth visiting the fort, if you have a guide with you. He will explain all the things about the fort because there is no proper explanation written about the area in the fort.
The fort was not well maintained by the government, most of the areas were damaged because of lack maintenance.
The entry fee of the fort is just 25 rs.
They didnt allow the tripod inside the fort, if you have a tripod with you keep it in your car because they dont have any section for luggage or any other things to keep.

review_text:

No need to do tracking because there are stairs throughout the fort but would suggest to wear comfortable clothes,And the view from the top of the fort is amazing. Only cash was accepted for entry tickets, 25/- per person and kids have free entry. Also shops inside the fort accept cash only as theres very little network.
Note. Not enough parking space available for four wheelers.

name: vikram aadithyan
review_text:
Among the biggest forts Ive ever seen. Because of its immense size, an in-depth look should take two to three hours. More captivating than the pages of history books, Golcondas stunning architecture and stone walls are what really enchant visitors, even if guides are available at the entrance to share the rich history of the resort (for a price).

Convenient refreshment outlets inside the fort, together with its thorough preservation, guarantee a fun stay. The sweeping, birds-eye view that is visible from the summit is quite amazing. Even though the ascent may need some walking, the effort is worthwhile because there are many photogenic locations and amazing vistas. Find a modest temple and well-placed stores that provide water, drinks, and snacks so you wont need to bring food.

Just remember not to trash there and instead drop the stuff in the bins that are located across the campus.

Pros: UPI payment facility just by scanning the QR code, small tuck stores, entry fee (adult - 25 and kid-10), restrooms.

Cons: i dont find anything.
Visited on
Weekend

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
No

name: User not Found
review_text:
Golconda, a historic fort and citadel located on the western outskirts of Hyderabad, India, stands as an imposing symbol of grandeur and architectural brilliance. Originally built during the medieval period by the Kakatiya dynasty, Golconda gained prominence under the rule of the Qutb Shahi dynasty in the 16th century. The fort complex, nestled amid rocky hills and lush landscapes, spans an expansive area, featuring a sophisticated network of palaces, gates, and defensive structures.

The very name Golconda is believed to have originated from the Telugu words Golla Konda, which translates to Shepherds Hill. This etymology reflects the forts strategic location atop a granite hill that provides panoramic views of the surrounding plains. The forts historical significance is deeply intertwined with the rise and fall of various dynasties that ruled the Deccan region.

The main entrance, known as the Fateh Darwaza or Victory Gate, greets visitors with intricate stucco work and imposing gates that once witnessed the grandeur of royal processions. As one ventures deeper into the fort, the sprawling expanse reveals the grandeur of the Qutb Shahi rulers. The fort is divided into four distinct forts, each surrounded by robust walls and bastions, creating a formidable defense system.

The heart of Golconda Fort houses the royal palaces and courtyards, such as the Durbar Hall, where the Qutb Shahi kings held court and conducted official proceedings. The grandeur of the architectural elements, from the stately domes to the ornate arches, reflects the opulence of the bygone era. The intricate designs and carvings on the walls and ceilings showcase a fusion of Persian, Hindu, and Rajput architectural influences, creating a unique blend that epitomizes the Deccan style.

One of the most captivating features within Golconda is the Taramati Baradari, an open pavilion that once served as a royal banquet hall. Named after Taramati, a courtesan who enchanted the seventh Qutb Shahi ruler, the Baradari offers breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape. Its architecture seamlessly integrates with the natural surroundings, creating a serene and picturesque setting.

Golconda Forts strategic location made it a pivotal center for trade and commerce during its heyday. The fort was a hub for diamond trade, as the Golconda region was known for its diamond mines, producing some of the worlds most renowned diamonds, including the Koh-i-Noor and the Hope Diamond. The Golconda diamond mines attracted traders and merchants from far and wide, contributing to the economic prosperity of the region.

Despite its military significance and economic prosperity, Golconda Fort also became a cultural and artistic center. The Qutb Shahi rulers were patrons of literature, music, and dance, fostering an environment where poets and artists flourished. The fort witnessed the development of the Qutb Shahi style of architecture and the Deccani school of painting, leaving an indelible mark on the cultural landscape of the Deccan region.

Golconda Forts historical narrative takes a dramatic turn with the arrival of the Mughals in the 17th century. After a prolonged siege, Golconda fell into the hands of Aurangzeb, marking the end of the Qutb Shahi dynasty. Subsequent years saw the fort undergo modifications and repairs under Mughal rule, reflecting a fusion of architectural styles. However, as the political landscape evolved, Golconda gradually lost its strategic importance, and the fort fell into a state of neglect.

Today, Golconda Fort stands as a testament to the rich history and cultural legacy of the Deccan region. The remnants of its architectural splendor and the echoes of its past glory attract visitors from across the globe. The fort, now a UNESCO World Heritage Site, has been painstakingly restored to preserve its historical significance. As visitors ascend the steep pathways and explore the hidden chambers within the fort, they are transported back in time, witnessing the grandeur and majesty that once defined Golconda.

So much can be developed if there is will to do.

name: Afeef VP
review_text:
Discovering Golconda Fort was a mesmerizing journey through time! Originally built in the 11th century by Kakatiya ruler Prataparudra, this ancient citadel near Hyderabad embodies centuries of history. Once the capital of the Golconda Sultanate, it flourished as a diamond trade hub, boasting the famed Golconda Diamonds from the nearby Kollur Mine.Wandering through the well-preserved ruins, you feel the echoes of a bygone era. Despite being in picturesque disrepair, Golcondas charm is undeniable. UNESCO recognized its historical significance, listing it as a potential World Heritage Site in 2014.For history enthusiasts and those seeking a glimpse into Indias rich past, Golconda Fort is a must-visit gem. Each stone whispers tales of empires, trade, and the indomitable spirit of a once-thriving city. A captivating experience blending ancient allure and architectural beauty! #GolcondaFort #HyderabadHistory

Revisiting time of diamonds sold putting on streets including  kohinoor  ..
A great legacy..

name: Sharanya Shree
review_text:
If youre looking for a historical weekend getaway to enjoy with family and friends, Golconda fort is the best place to visit. Ensure you have your walking shoes and caps on as you might have to deal with crazy sunlight plus walking! Keep a few water bottles and snacks ready. You can buy the tickets at the counter. Go ahead and explore the beautiful architecture and history of Golconda!

(I would suggest reading a bit on Golconda beforehand for a better experience)

name: varsha babu
review_text:
Golconda Fort is an incredible place to explore! Located in Hyderabad, its like stepping back in time. The fort is huge and has a lot of history hidden within its walls.

Climbing to the top is a bit of a workout, but totally worth it. The view from up there is breathtaking! You can see the whole city, and its especially beautiful during sunset.

Inside the fort, there are ancient structures, like the Kings palace and old mosques. Its like a journey into the past. The guides share interesting stories about the kings who lived there, making the visit even more enjoyable.

One cool thing about Golconda Fort is the acoustic system. You can stand at one end and whisper, and someone at the other end can hear you - its like a historic telephone!

The light and sound show in the evening is a must-see. It brings the history to life with colorful lights and storytelling.

Visiting Golconda Fort is not just a history lesson, but also a fun day out. Whether you love history or just want to explore, this fort has it all. I had a fantastic time discovering the secrets of Golconda!
Visited on
Weekday

Wait time
No wait

Reservation recommended
Not sure

name: Meenal Deshpande
review_text:
We hired a Guide who was aware of all the details like history and tidbits of the fort. He charged around 750 rs. It was worth the amount and time.

We enjoyed knowing the history and architecture and appreciated the strength and wisdom in the absence of technology.

It is important to carry water bottles/snacks as one gets really tired walking and climbing the fort.
There is a shop inside but at the time we went, the UPI was not working and they asked for cash.

name: Abhishek Ranjan
review_text:
Best place to spend a short holiday with friends and family. Entry fees is 20 rupees. You can book ticket through the QR code scan as well rather standing in queue.
I would suggest to visit this place during winter, pre winter , autumn, spring seasons. Avoid summer season.
If you are going with small kids then make sure to take their foods along with water and milk.
It requires bit effort to climb the forte till top. Dont worry it wont take long. Make sure to take pics at whatever place you feel.
Online payment is not accepted on the top. Make sure to take some cash with you as once u reach top you may need water or some minor snacks item.
I have visited 3 times. I love it

name: babu thangadancha
review_text:
Reaching fort - People coming to fort increased a lot, and lot of vehicles public/private are allowed near to the fort, but roads are the same since years, all vehicles need to go through narrow kamans (nawab (king) days doors) only. Which is taking hours to reach the fort if you go by cars/bus. Better get down at the kaman itself and walk 500 - 800 meters, better avoid own cars else will get stuck in traffic.
Entry Ticket - only cash allowed that to exact change, they wont allow any online payments in this digital era.
Food - Take your own food. No food stalls inside the fort. Will get only junk food, chips, fried peanut packets and ice cream, here TS tourism is encouraging junk food inside the fort even though there is a scope to have good stalls inside the fort. And in this junk food also, only one or two brands (mostly unknown brands) available. Out side the fort food stalls (very less and full of junk food) have more crowd. At Dharbal hall inside the fort, there is a small junk food stall and only asks money & no digital payments, and do not listen to the customers, misbehaves with them, if we argue, then they tell us in rude way to go and give complaint to any one we want and they do not care of these complaints.
Toilets inside the fort - very worst experience, only available near the entrance and one at mahal (palace), that too water in the toilets will be stopped if no money is given to them.
Signboards to see each and every corner of the fort - worst,. Has to take guide or has to go behind the others.
Maintenance of fort - not at all good. Lot of scope to retain the architecture.

Hope the govt will take care as early as possible to maintain the fort. And provide options to have good facilities like good food (inside and outside the fort), toilets (inside the fort), smoother vehicle movements (outside the fort), parking (outside the fort)...etc., and maintain them properly without damage to the fort. Proud of conducting national flag hoisting festival at the fort, but just this activity do not bring pride to the fort/Hyderabad, taking care of the above issues will attract the more tourists.
Visited on
Public holiday

Wait time
1 hr+

name: jaymin parmar
review_text:
Golconda Fort, nestled in the heart of Hyderabad, stands as a magnificent testament to the citys rich history and architectural prowess. The sprawling fort complex unfolds a narrative of the bygone era, captivating visitors with its grandeur and strategic design. The intricately carved gates, sprawling lawns, and the panoramic views from the top transport visitors to a different era, offering a fascinating glimpse into the Deccans regal past.

As you ascend the forts multiple tiers, each step unveils architectural marvels and stories of conquest. The remarkable acoustic design of the Fateh Darwaza, where a clap at the entrance can be heard at the highest point, adds a unique touch to the experience. The forts expansive grounds provide ample space for exploration and reflection, making it an ideal destination for history enthusiasts and casual visitors alike. Golconda Fort is not just a historical monument; its a journey through time, allowing visitors to immerse themselves in the grandeur and tales of Hyderabads royal legacy.
Visited on
Weekend

name: Adweeka bankuru
review_text:
Golconda is a fortified citadel and ruined city located in the western outskirts of Hyderabad, Telangana, India.

Golconda was the principal capital of the Qutub Shahi kings. The inner fort contains ruins of palaces, mosques and a hill top pavilion, which rises about 130 meters high and gives a birds eye view of other buildings.

It would take almost 2 -3hrs to completely see the fort. We can book tickets online or directly at the ticket counter. Online booking cost per person - 20rs while at the ticket counter- 25rs. Its better to carry cash, water and food items. No card payment or online transactions are available at the ticket counter or inside the fort. Its the best visit in the evening to see the beauty of hyderabad and Golconda fort with beautiful lights.

There is also a temple on the top of the fort and Inside the fort there is a small prison known as the Ramdas Jail where Bhakt Ramdas was imprisoned.
Visited on
Weekend

No wait

Reservation recommended

name: Sohom Banerjee
review_text:
Golconda Fort is one of the most famous heritage of Indian History. It was built by king Prataprudradeb of the Kakatiya dynasty of Warangal, modern Telengana in the 12th century. Golconda fort originally known as Mankal.It is considered Indias one of the most outstanding citadels made of mud walls. The Golconda fort epitomises the sumptuous Nawabi culture of the time. Later, it came into the possession of the Bahamani dynasty. After that during the time of Qutub Shahi dynasty Golconda became the capital and owes much of its present grandeur to Mohammad Quli Qutub Shah who was the founder of the Hyderabad city and ruled from 1565 CE to 1612 CE.

Weekend
